Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: drseussen
Reviews.Content: Very nice downtown hotel. Great location. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott stay ever”
Reviews.Author: SammaMichelle
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at Marriott, it's the chain we accumulate points with but I can honestly say because of this hotel and the staff...that will probably be changing soon! The staff was rude and very unhelpful. The pillows were unbearable; we called to ask if there was anything they could do and they pretty much all but told my husband "we don't really care". The computers and printers in the business center weren't working, no one cared or offered to fix when we inquired at the desk. The ONLY nice person we met on this trip was the bartender and he gave us some great tips for eating at North End but other than that, the location was the only plus of this hotel. The worst part....it was incredibly expensive!! I'm very disappointed in Marriott and how they have allowed themselves to fall victim to the "we don't really care about our customers' routine that so many others have done. Good thing the hotel didn't ruin our stay in this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Loud!!”
Reviews.Author: Jkms0316
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing. The amount of loud partying that went on is more on par with a cheap motel. We had to call security numerous times throughout our stay for noise control, and the loud partying continued until about 4 am. Room rates are high and the quality of the stay was a disappointment. The rooms are very clean and the hotel restaurant was amazing though!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good view”
Reviews.Author: lambsidell
Reviews.Content: this was my first time staying at the Long Wharf and they were fantastic. Checkin was a bit slow but the door man and everyone there was very helpful. When I asked for a roll-a-way and extra pillows it was no more than 3 min to have it added to my room. The entire staff was very nice and while the lift was out of service and we had a stroller they showed us to the back service lift and made life much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: sbayley1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for a convention on Boston. The location is absolutely perfect. You can easily walk to the Aquarium, Faneiul Hall and lots of other attractions. We stayed on the concierge floor and had a view of the park. The windows in our room stretched out over about 12 feet, so the view of the city was gorgeous, especially at night. The room was clean and comfortable and about what we would have expected from a Marriott. The bathroom was small but updated and clean. The concierge club had limited offerings compared to what we've seen in other Marriotts, but it was decent and someone was staffing it all of the time. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: frankie1Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February 2012. Its a nice hotel right in the thick of things that would be of interest to a tourist. The only fault I have is the noise. The way the hotel is constructed is to blame I believe. There is a large tunnel like space going up many levels as you walk into the hotel. As our room was close to this area, we suffered "funnel effect" noise. You could hear people coming into the hotel at all hours. The hallways are really noisy. At one point I got up to see what the problem was and the people were at the farest part of the hallway but sounded like they were right outside our door. Also the walls in between the rooms are made out of paper almost as you can hear people talking at a normal lever. You can walk to any of the attractions in Boston from here. The only problem on this trip was going back to that noisy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sailgirl57
Reviews.Content: Boston Marriott Long Wharf is centrally located for taking in the sites of Boston. Located next to the New England Aquarium and across the street from Fanueil Hall you can easily access these spots as well as picking up trolley tour or walking the Freedom Trail. And its about a 15 minute ride to Logan. Several restaurants are nearby. The hotel is pleasant, the rooms comfortable although the hallways tend to be a bit noisy. Also the concierge level is not open on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MRL217
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for business. Staff at checkin were friendly and accommodating. Restaurants (both) were slow and non-responsive. Both were crowded and the service was slow and not very friendly. Food was disappointing, but not terrible. However, the hotel staff were very friendly and were attentive. Rooms are comfortable; I had no issues with heat, water, etc. as did some previous reviewers. I thought the room was beautifully appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “simply the worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola B
Reviews.Content: I've been Platinum member with Marriot few years and Diamond with Hilton for a dozen years since i spend 150 nights/yr in hotels. during check in I asked for pool hrs: pool was closed for renovation. I pointed out there was no warning for that and wanted some compensation since i need to do laps for back problems. I was confronted by the personell about this and treated like a liar. than they tried to make a new reservation with my iphone and... surprise! no warning came up! thay gave me 15.000 points as compensation which is ok but i still didn't like the treatment and they didn't apologize. than i got an upgrade (as Platinum) but was accessible room which has a very unconfortable toilet. the room was very cold. rised the temperature from 65 to max and left the room. came back at midnight, it was freezing. I was tired and went to bed dressed up. the following morning was still freezing, wifi was not working... went down to reception mentioning all problems. i was supposed to stay 2 nights but i decided to change hotel and they really didn't care. I asked for a late check out... i was given 2pm!!! which is like standard check out... the lady said they were sold out.... well beside the fact that i was freeing my room so they had an extra room at that time... i went on the website and checked availability: they had more than 1 room like mine available! who is the liar????? than i called the manager to complain but i just got another bad treatment... wow, these people deserve a zero!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: missindisney_11
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Marriott Long Wharf and we made a great decision. From the moment we arrived, we felt welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff. We were able to check in early and were happy to find out that our room was ready. This was a great help b/c we were able to park our car and put our bags in our room. The staff (the helpful friendly doormen, everyone at the front desk, the man who brought the rollaway bed to our room, the wait staff) were all terrific. The hotel lobby is beautiful - our room was very clean and quiet. The only complaints we had, were the pillows weren't the greatest; the windows were pretty grimey (despite the great view); the breakfast buffet wasn't refilled very well. That may sound petty, but when your kids are hungry and you want to get your day started so you can get to the musuems, it can be frustrating to wait for eggs, and pancakes. The food was very good though. The hotel's location was really great - walking distance to the Aquarium, Quincy Market and the North End. We look forward to coming back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A year or so ago this was a tired old hotel...no longer!”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand54
Reviews.Content: "The Long Wharf" led the Boston renaissance in the 70s & 80s...and never quite caught up until the last year or so. Now it's cool and chic on Boston's waterfront. A definite "stay" if you find a good price...tho' that's not easy. I wouldn't call it top shelf but I'm happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: MickyD19
Reviews.Content: Every single aspect of our stay here was perfect. We had eight people, three rooms, for one night. I simply could not believe how well run the hotel was. We called the morning of our stay and asked the Room Controller to locate our rooms near each other. No problem. We asked for an early check in. No problem. We asked for a late check out. No problem. We asked for two roll-away-beds. No problem (and surprisingly comfortable). We asked for a room fridge. No problem. The rooms were excellent. The AAA room rate included breakfast, and what a fantastic value. The breakfast was top-of-the line, the dining room comfortable, and the wait staff excellent (thanks Mr. Duffy). Everyone was Boston friendly. The hotel location is tremendous. The morning walk along the harbor front walkway and into the North End is worth the stay. I was really, genuinely surprising impressed with what a terrific hotel operation it was. My hat's off to the management team and the line employees. Perfect in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: coldinNH603
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for spending a weekend in Boston. You are right next to the Aquarium, across the street from Faneuil Hall, and a short walk to the North End. While the hotel looks really nice, there are some issues. We spent one night over a recent weekend as a treat for our daughter who is 6. Check-in was a breeze. The room looked really nice...until we stepped onto a giant wet spot on the floor between the 2 beds. Thinking it was just spilled water, we let it go. But when attempting to sleep later that night, we realized that it was a poor attempt to clean up vomit because we could now smell it. By that time, it was really too late for us to do anything about it. Also beware...when showering at 7AM, we had lukewarm water at best and the water is very soft making it really tough to wash the soap off. We were also really looking forward to spending time in the pool, but the pool water and area were quite cool. We could only spend about 20 minutes there before we were all shivering. For the $159/night, it wasn't a bad deal for Boston, but it wasn't the nice stay we were hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sher777
Reviews.Content: From making the reservation to check in to check out, our experience was more than expected. Staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly and we appreciated that. I requested a lower level room, king sized bed, extra foam pillows, air purifer and received ALL, much to my happiness. The linens were wonderfully fresh, the room was immaculate. It is so close to shopping and dining. Although we could have taken a cab, we enjoyed our walk to and from dinner in Boston's north end. This is our second time staying here and it won't be our last! Bell Hops/concierge's Randy and Michael were outstanding! Not to diminish the rest of the outstanding staff, we just didn't get their names.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family get away”
Reviews.Author: Mainemom207
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 2 teenage children, spent the night at the Long Wharf a few weeks ago. I have been staying at the Long Wharf since it has been open. The most recent updates are wonderful- sleek, modern and clean. While my husband and I attended a conference, our children spent the morning swimming and working out and then walked across the street to Faneuil Hall. The staff were helpful and courteous. No problems at check-in. Room was clean and spacious. We had a roll away bed and it fit fine. We walked to the North End for dinner, stopped at Mike's Pastry on the way home and popped into the bar at the hotel for a night cap! The next day we all walked over to the Aquarium. A perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “February Break with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Aviva313
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful couple of days at the Marriott Long Warf. It is walking steps away from the Aquarium and Faneuil Hall, Children's Musuem and so much more!! The hotel was very, clean and the Concierge Staff, Jamie Palacios & Dayci Rodriguez could not have been any more hospitable. They made our stay excellent instead of just good!! The view was stunning from the concierge lounge and you really felt like you were on a boat. The only negative thing I can say is that the pool on line is very decieving, it is not very large and there was no lounge chairs to use, so for the kids it was ok but not the adults... It was not that luxurious feeling that you get looking at the pictures on line!!! Work out room terrific and the food excellent as well...Have fun....

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience President's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KennyJacob
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with my wife and two young children this past long weekend. The location, the updated room, and mostly the service made this a great weekend for our family! When we checked in, the room we requested was no longer available, but the person that checked us in, made sure that we were well taken care of with another room and added in a breakfast certificate (Not necessary, but truly appreciated) We thoroughly enjoyed our Sunday brunch which had plenty of choices and fresh fruit, bread, pastries etc. Had asked for extra pillows, towels, turn-down service several times, and the staff was always prompt in responding! Traveling with little kids can sometimes be difficult, but it was easy here. The kids loved the pool (Small pool, but met the needs of the kids), loved the convenience to The New England Aquarium (Litterally next door) short walking distance to The Boston Children's Museum which is a must if you are visiting with kids, and of course The North End, Faneuil Hall / Quincy Market. The Subway is underneath the hotel and it's a short trip to Cambridge / Harvard Square. The only downside to our stay (and i'm being picky) We would have loved to have a little more water pressure in the shower, but it was not a deal breaker at all. We look forward to visiting when it's a touch warmer so we can take advantage of some of the water activities right outside of the hotel like the Whale Watching trip. Thanks to the management and staff of Marriott Long Wharf. We will be back the next time we are in Boston. No reason to ever stay some place else!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Long Wharf - great location”
Reviews.Author: cgras777
Reviews.Content: Boston Marriott Long Wharf - great location - reasonable rates - very clean and excellent staff. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: hcn10
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for a bridal shower that was in the North end...so nice! Beautiful location, very close to restaurants/North end. Staff could not be more helpful and pleasant. I was sad to leave...would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great staff - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: ChapmanDan
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from a weeks stay on business and I have no complaints at all. As far as location goes it's pretty well located in Boston with a T (underground/metro) stop adjacent and close to the North End and Quincy Market plus you can get the water taxi from the airport almost directly to the hotel front door for a bit of novelty (I normally do for some fresh air after 7 hours on a plane). The hotel itself was just fine in terms of decor, clean, functional and perfectly comfortable. We were in and out of the conference facilities too all week which were equally well maintained. The communal areas like the lobby and the bar were comfortable and i did grab a bite in the bar one night which was pretty good too. The real stand out feature were the staff as they were friendly and helpful without being too overbearing. I'd happily stay here again next time i'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: aathef
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - across the street from Faneuil Hall and a very short walk to the heart of the North End. The staff is tremendously friendly and helpful. Lobby is huge and you can hang out there (and use the nice bathrooms!) even after you've checked out. There's a T stop there as well. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott Long Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Doug M P P
Reviews.Content: I've stayed it this hotel almost eveytime in Boston. The new renovations turned out great. The updated loby, restaurant and bar make it a great place to gather and meet with friends and colleagues. Good fitness center with a wide selection of today's equipment. The hotel is always clean and the staff is always nice and knowledgable. Love the location of this hotel. Scenic harbor surrounded by vistor goldmines including the Boston Aquarium, Quincy Market, Imax Theater, great restaurants and the Boston Garden is only a short walk away. It's a great hotel to stay while in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed my expectations. The lobby has a modern feel to it and is complimented by tHe bar and restaurant. This hotel has the first restaurant where the breakfast experience is totally different from the dinner experience, while making both meals a true pleasure. The hotel is perfectly located near the T (subway) and right across the street from Quincy market. The bedroom is very comfortable and the beds felt even better. All of ethe hotel features were perfectly combined with great service from the entire staff. From the knowledgeable doormen to the courteous restaurant staff. The General Manager of this hotel must be very proud of his team.pp When I come back to Boston, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WJ2011
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Long Wharf is a great location for enjoying the sights in Boston. It is steps from a Legal Seafoods Restaurant (which I highly recommend), near the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are typical Marriott, and try to get a room with a water view.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Get Away”
Reviews.Author: garindav
Reviews.Content: can't say enough about this hotel. We were at their opening 29 years ago and many times since and have never had a bad experience. Got a great view ,comfy beds and it was very clean ! Staff was helpful in all ways.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Long Wharf, Boston, MA”
Reviews.Author: lucyanne1
Reviews.Content: The selling point of this hotel is the location: right next to Quincy Market! The hotel is lovely and right on the waterfront. Lots to look at just wandering around.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: fjon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Boston with my family. I must say this is the ideal location for sightseeing in Boston. You can walk almost anywhere! Right across from the Quincy Marketplace, Freedom Trail, Beacon Hill, North End, etc....Tons of great restaurants nearby. The water taxi to the airport is right there as well as access to the T and bus tours. As an elite member, I had requested a quiet room ahead of time. As well, we asked for adjoining rooms. Previous reviews advised to stay away from rooms that open onto the central lobby and that is where they put us! We did get adjoining rooms, but the music and noise from the lounge could be heard in our room. When I asked about changing rooms, they indicated that we could pay to upgrade to another room. We were already unpacked and didn't feel like lugging our bags over to another room. Marriott needs to treat their Elite members better. As other reviewers indicated, the breakfast buffet was good but $25.00+ is quite pricey when you can walk to other places nearby. We had drinks and appetizers in the lounge one evening and we had two hunt down our waitress a couple of times to order more drinks and finally settle the tab. Health Club looked large and plenty of the usual machines...we were too busy to use it. The pool looked OK....but full of kids. A little mix up with the bill at check-out, but they managed to fix it rather quickly. Overall, there are tons of great hotels in Boston...I will think twice about where I stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for new years stayover”
Reviews.Author: skiguy33
Reviews.Content: This was the ideal spot for new years eve - perfect location to view the fireworks over the harbor, subway right out the front door, short walk to Faneuil Hall and the North End. Our room and the property were clean and the staff was, for the most part, friendly and prompt. My only suggestion is to encourage bartenders to project a more happy and welcoming persona as well as move faster amongst patrons. I know it was new years eve but even on new years day most of the staff behind the bar were lacking in this area. The bellman were extremely service oriented!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good food and accomodations for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: Teresita_Herndon_VA
Reviews.Content: I've been to a ton of business conferences in my professional life, and many of the venues left a lot to be desired. Not so with this hotel! My colleagues and I all found the check-in easy, guest rooms exceedingly comfortable, and the breakfast and conference amenities much better than anticipated. While the breakfast is a buffet, this was a far cry from the usual soupy scrambled eggs and limp bacon. While the food on the buffet line was good, there were multiple stations to have fresh food made to order, including eggs, omelets, and waffles. There were a large number of healthy choices including fresh fruit and whole-grain breads, and their coffee was excellent - a big plus during a business conference! The bar is spacious enough to allow groups to gather while still having some more private seating, and the service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for work conference”
Reviews.Author: RobW9999
Reviews.Content: The company I work for had a conference here at the Boston Marriott Long Wharf. Nice place overall having been recently renovated. It's also near everything downtown which is handy. The service was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: SwtVABrz7
Reviews.Content: The convenience of this hotel can't be beat! It is the first stop on the Old Trolley Tour (a great way to see the city if you're a first time visitor), has a metro stop at the front entrance, is conveniently located across the street from a large variety of quick food stops and restaurants, AND offers scenic views of the Wharf. It is located next door to the aquarium. The water taxi stop that goes to and from the airport is located adjacent to the side entrance of the hotel. The water taxi offers a unique and fun method of transportation that is uniquely Boston! Also, the taxi is highly reasonable and efficient. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor serving light breakfast fare and most Starbucks beverages- a great quick breakfast stop for us! The location, friendly staff, and knowledgeable hotel concierge truly make this hotel an excellent location for anyone visiting Boston, but especially those that have never been before. Our room (located down the hall, away from the lobby, and with a water/Wharf view) was clean and comfortable; however, it was not quiet. The noise from the lobby echoes, (including lobby music and typical lobby hustle/bustle sounds), can be heard while in the room. The walls are extremely thin, so much so that we could clearly make out conversations from our neighbors. The Wharf, although scenic, is also quite noisy. Every morning, throughout the day, and sometimes late at night, the loud horns from the boats coming and going are easily heard. If you're up and out early, and out late, sightseeing and enjoying all Boston has to offer, this noise might not be a problem. After all, we didn't come to Boston to sleep and lounge in the room. The pro's definitely outweigh the con's here; Overall, a great place to stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good choice for business hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rogerslb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for business near the government center 8 blocks north. Generally hearing from co-workers that the Longwharf is slightly nicer than Marriott Copley at this point and I was satisfied with the hotel Pros 1) Front desk was very friendly and was easily able to fax a few things for free 2) Upgraded as platinum premier to conceirge level - room was pretty OK size Cons 1) Wasn't enamored by food in concierge lounge - breakfast choices were average and the apps at night were mainly fried which I found stange .. also found wine for $10 per glass high in lounge compared to other places 2) One of the Marriotts that is still serving Merdian Merlot for platinum gift - much like the alternative selections at some places 3) Didn't particularly think the area was very interesting at night ... ate downstairs at restaurant on Mon night - food and service was good but kind of dead Going to try the Ritz next time which has the same govt rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in cerain rooms, awful in others”
Reviews.Author: Zeke-n-Sheila
Reviews.Content: We ahve stayed here several times. This is an excellent hotel with excellent service IF you get a room in a good section of the hotel. If you get a room in the outer corners or the end near the main street, they are superb. if you get one anywhere near the center, elevators or lounge, you will hear various noise til about 3 am and then starting up again around 6am when people start getting up. Also, I highly recommend requesting a king room rather than a double bed . The rooms are bigger and have better amenities. The location is excellent.....you are right in the middle of a lot of action and site seeing. You can comfortably walk to the famous North End for supper and/or dessert.....to the aquarium for touristy stuff and across the street to great bars & clubs. It is also a short walk to The Spirit of Boston cruises.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, even better service.”
Reviews.Author: tag1970
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed for one night for a romantic getaway... they knew it was my birthday, so they sent up a beautiful tray of brie, crackers, and a bottle of wine with two glasses!! What a very nice touch. Concierge had fabulous recommendations (and directions) for dinner in the North End. It was FREEZING out, but worth the very short walk. Our room was pretty, super clean, but somewhat small. Bathroom is SUPER small... but again, very clean. Pool is also smaller than the picture appears. We did not swim, as there were a ton of kids swimming (great for families, right next to the New England Aquarium!) I had requested a water view, but we were put in a room facing the city. Sirens somewhat noisy during the night, but very brief. Beautiful view of the city lights at night. Every staff person we came in contact with had a big smile, and a hello. Service was top notch. Will definitely go back, but won't do the breakfast buffet again. $23 per person is a little steep for breakfast. Overall, a beautiful hotel in a great location with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Ivela
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite Hotels in Boston. It is close to all my favorite places in Boston like Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Legal Seafood Restaurant and Imack and Bolio's Icecream Parlor. It is close to the North End, right next to the Aquarium, you can walk everywhere. The breakfast at the Marriott is the best. Even bread pudding for breakfast! I just love it. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Got to agree, it's really nice”
Reviews.Author: JohntheLast
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on business. Walking to the North End. Convenient to the "T". Very attractive lobby, and really great concierge room with a view to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful waterfront hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley M
Reviews.Content: My brother got us a room here as a gift after my wedding. The hotel is so beautiful, it's right on the water as well. The view from the rooms are gorgeous, whether it be summer, winter, whatever! It's near the subway and pretty much everything Boston has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Class,and location.Best clam chowder I`ve had.Three bowls.Burp...”
Reviews.Author: tluddy1
Reviews.Content: Class all the way. The location is excellent. Just steps to Faneuil Hall, and Qincy Market. Hell, I`d stay here just for the chowder! Staff is top notch. Rooms very nice, and spotless, as was the entire hotel. Yes, the people here take PRIDE in the way this place looks. Not one sour note. WILL come again!

Reviews.Title: “All the good stuff about Marriott is here”
Reviews.Author: lustytraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only improved with age. The staff is helpful and professional, the rooms are extremely comfortable, the concierge lounge is well managed, and the location cannot be beat if you like to haunt the North End for food. Have tried other hotels in Boston and have found that this property consistently delivers on comfort, service and convenience at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, and hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedHead829
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time at this Marriot and was very impressed. Beautiful hotel, excellent location, and the staff was excellent. Concierge (Sargent) was a hoot to talk to. He arranged everything from things to do, where to eat, made reservations and got our tickets. Made everything so much easier. If I had to find something they could improve upon I would have to say the size of the towels at the pool, which really is minor to me since we had the nice plush robes from the room. Had a great time. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alyonam
Reviews.Content: Just 5 steps from subways station and 10 steps from harbor (including Boston aquarium and stop of whale watching ferries). Exceptional sea food restaurants nearby and vivid market 5 minutes by walk. Very good newly decorated big rooms and friendly staff. Gym and business center. Wireless is not free, but reasonably priced and high speed.

Reviews.Title: “My go-to hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: serenaginer
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Marriott Long Wharf since the eighties, so I have fond memories of the hotel. You can't beat the location, and all the staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful. We live in a noisy city so the traffic noise was normal for us. If you're used to country quiet, you might want a room farther away from the main road. Since we are from a warm climate, the room did seem a little bit drafty, but I've experienced much worse at more expensive hotels. This is a pricey hotel, but worth it for a fun Boston experience.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: arc319
Reviews.Content: We were a family of six ages 5 thru 70 staying one night and we all had a wonderful experience here. Easy walk to Faneuil Hall, the North End and the Aquarium. Short taxi ride to the theater district or Newbury street. Excellent staff and service. The children had lots of fun using the pool after dinner when there's not a lot for young ones to do in winter. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and very good. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mainegurl2442
Reviews.Content: I have been a long time customer of this hotel and have never been disappointed. I first stayed at this hotel when I was a preteen on a birthday trip to Boston. I felt like a princess going down the main entrance escalator to head out on the town for a big birthday dinner. It is conveniently located near shopping, historic buildings, the harbor and the aquarium. Perfect for family trips. It is also easily accessible to South Station if you are traveling anywhere by bus or train. I have returned on many occasions -- most recently just this past week. I was able to book online in the same day, make use of excellent valet parking and check in using my AAA discount all with ease. My fiance and I had arrived in Boston late at night and were tired and hungry. The room was beautiful and clean. It was also quiet and well stocked with nice soaps (Bath and Body Works Aroma Therapy Line) and soft towels. We went to the hotel's "Waterline" Restaurant for dinner. It was fantastic, intimate and romantic. It was not overly stuffy but at the same time very good food, nice atmosphere and easy to relax in. We got a seat right by the window and got to watch the city move about through the Christmas lights. We asked for a wake up call at 3am -- which came right on time. We were able to get our car out of the valet parking at 4am and were off to NYC. It couldn't have been more perfect and we really appreciate this hotel. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: frequentfyer10
Reviews.Content: I am Diamond with Hilton Honors and spend on average over 40 nights a year traveling for business. This hotel has it all. Great location and outstanding associates. Very helpful and friendly. Will be back when I am in Boston again. Sorry Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: StephanieMcD
Reviews.Content: The Long Wharf is great because of the location to so many attractions. Nice clean room, plenty of space,The staff was friendly, smiling and helpful. The restaurant, Waterline, is nice and food is pretty good. We had a great view of Christopher Columbus Park (it was beautiful lit up at night!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be by the water”
Reviews.Author: Mammo64
Reviews.Content: Gym is awesome as recently updated. Conciege lounge has good view but food is not great. Legal Seafood is very close. Great service and would stay again. View from my room was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful lobby, nice room, GREAT location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MojitoMaker
Reviews.Content: Happy to be staying here. We have stayed in many hotels in Boston and liked most of them. The Long Wharf is great because of the location to so many attractions. We ate next door at Chart House and it was fantastic. Nice clean room, plenty of space, even a little waterview from the room. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bargin but you get what you expect”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this Marriott and it has a higher end price because of it's locationYou are at the base of State Street and have access by foot to a lot of site seeing stuff. The staff was nice and helpful and they updated the gym which is a major improvement for me because I like to work out. The views were great from my room. I had a.ccess to the executive level which they upgraded me to and the breakfast and deserts were very good. Some hotels I stay at have free beer and wine or prices below the bar in the lobby. That wasn't true here. I will stay at this hotel again unless I am on a budget. There are some nice hotels like the Hilton and Millenium near by that are a better price but no view or comprerable gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbourside location adjacent Faneuil Hall Market Place”
Reviews.Author: GaryCI
Reviews.Content: A hotel for several years trying to use when travelling to Boston, but always full, on this occassion successful but not as inspiring as expecting. Location is great, nice lobby, miserable bar staff who afetr one drink made our party wish to go elsehwere and with the choices around at far better prices we did and glad we did. Rooms comfortable, slightly dated but still good working order and pleasing decor. This hotel is really for location and couldn't say it was home from home, so whilst love Boston and it's citizens this hotel will not be on my list again

Reviews.Title: “best tourist location, great view and super staff”
Reviews.Author: laconcierge
Reviews.Content: We got two rooms for the weekend at a rate that you would expect to be treated like second class at and that was far from the case, especially with a small army of kids. When we arrived our rooms had been thoughtfully planned out to be near the pool for the kids, adjoining rooms and a beautiful view! The staff here was not just professional, they were genuinely nice, friendly, helpful. I stopped down to pick myself and a friend up a cocktail after a long family day and the bartender whipped up an amazing drink with fresh raspberries. There are a million tourist friendly things to do just a few blocks away and a T stop on the block. With a view of the marina added to the mix I don't think you can find a better location. If you are between the Long Wharf and another hotel that is slightly less expensive I would start factoring what you might save in cab fair by staying at the Long Wharf. Pool was clean, perfect temp, but a city size not full size. Sad that they did not have brunch but the the room service food was all very good!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, but I miss the old bar!”
Reviews.Author: tuckertwo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in 2011. The first time was in February while in Boston for a conference. During that time, my review would have been a bit sub-par as the hotel was getting a noisy, unwelcoming facelift (why, I don't know, it was beautiful to begin with!). But for my next stay in July, I was pleasantly surprised-the construction was complete! During my first stay, I had a king room which was extremely comfy and very clean with all the amenities that Marriot has to offer with nice furniture and eye-pleasing decor. During my second stay I was in a room that had two double beds and again it was clean and very comfortable. It was super hot in July and the AC worked just fine. I never used any of the extra amenities such as the gym or pool, so I cannot comment on those features. The staff was very friendly and always made sure you 1. Had everything you needed and 2. Answered any questions that you may have about the area, and if they did not have the answer, they'd find it for you! The staff is certainly a great asset here, as is the location. It is very easy to access from North Station (we walked, bit of a hike but my boss hates subways), car. You can even take the silver line from Logan, and get off at Courthouse and walk, or take the Shuttle from it to the Blue Line and get off at the Aquarium stop. The addition of a Starbucks on the ground floor was definitely great for me, but I've got to say, I miss the old bar. The new bar and restaurant just do not have the same "nautical-homey-bostonian" feel for me. It is much more modern and a bit less comfortable. Drinks are still great, and the long Island Ice Teas are some of the best around! I have made this hotel my number one place to stay when traveling to Boston for certain trips!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: rick s
Reviews.Content: we arrived from las vegas very late at night, they gave us a room directly above the night club at the back of the hotel, luckily that night for us we were tired and the club had just put out last call. The next morning i expressed my displeasure with this room location, after spending the day at Quincy Market, we came back to a new upgraded room with a harbor view for no additional charge, the hotel was still under construction, but we were not bothered by any of it. overall a great experience at this hotel -

Reviews.Title: “Location was the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: SomerJane
Reviews.Content: When traveling to Boston by ferry from the Cape this hotel was PERFECT! The ferry landing was right outside the doors of this Marriott hotel right on the water, so we just rolled our suitcases right off the boat and into the hotel lobby. The subway entrance is right outside the hotel as well as the trolley stop. You would never have to rent a car in Boston if you stayed here! Taxis are also parked right outside this hotel if needed as well. We loved the awesome walking distance to attractions like the shopping across the street at Quincy Market! Loved that we could walk to Little Italy and get a yummy cannoli as well for the plane trip back! Would def stay at this hotel again just for location! Yes, it was clean and beds were comfy. Its a Marriott but it was worth the added price for our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Could Use Some Tweaking”
Reviews.Author: Mainers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times, at least once on the concierge level. This time we just had a standard room, typical Marriott, comfy beds, nicely furnished, granite countertops, single serving coffee/tea maker, mini frig, about average size for a hotel in the heart of the city. The location cannot be beat - the T is right outside, as is the harbor, the aquarium, the (very good) Legal Seafood restaurant and, of course, Quincy Market and the North End. Even the tour buses and harbor tour boats are right there. Also positive - great view of harbor from our room, a new lobby with a very welcoming bar/restaurant, with tv screens everywhere including some for your private viewing in the booths. A few negatives - no newspaper delivered to the door, USA Today and WSJ are available in lobby but no local newspapers. Would be nice to have the Boston Globe to check out local events and get a feel for the city. For the first time, our stay here was very noisy. We are silver Rewards members with standing request for quiet room, which has always been honored in the past. Our room was on the fifth floor, but it fronted on the atrium, right over the bar/lounge/restaurant. Not sure if they had a convention meeting there or just a large crowd, but it was noisy well into the night. I would definitely ask for a room away from the atrium if we return, and stay elsewhere if they couldn't guarentee it. Also, they charge for internet use, even in the lobby and the business center. They do have computers in the business center for free use, but center is not very private (no door, and it's open to the lobby). I also found that I could not navigate on their computers as I would on my laptop, there seemed to be some limitations -- and I was not trying to access any racy sites!! Just gmail, trip advisor, and some event listings. The towels were also extremely thin, not at all up to the standard that the price of the room would suggest. The room lacked a magnifying mirror, which is surprising with all the business people (incl women) who stay there. Altho the new lobby was nice, we did miss the seating near the Starbucks downstairs (the ground floor has just Starbucks, registration & lobby are up a flight). Before the renovations there was seating for Starbucks so you could have breakfast there or relax with coffee and pastry in afternoon. Now it is "to go" only, so you'd have to bring your coffee and treats back to the room or eat/drink on the go. Wondering if they eliminated seating to encourage guests to have breakfast in their newly renovated restaurant??

Reviews.Title: “Good harbour locatin”
Reviews.Author: BadgersFriend
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with easy access to harbour side activities. Some good views from the upper rooms. Pleasant bar that was not too noisy but had some atmosphere. Excellent decor in lobby atrium area.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Live4Maine
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to Quincy Market, Aquarium, the North End and Logan. We always stay here when in Boston and since the remodel it's even better than before, which is hard to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! I would definitely recommend this one to anybody. As soon as you get there, someone opens the door for you and asks how your day has been and chats with you for a few minutes while the valet driver gets information for your vehicle. They were very efficient. The front desk clerks were fantastic, fast check in and early check in as well, the lady made conversation with my boyfriend and I and was very pleasant. All of the staff had smiles on their faces. We went to the room and it was sparkling with cleanliness! (The housekeeper also helped us find our room) The only not so great thing was the bathroom, although still very clean just a little small and odd. Small double doors to get into it and somewhat of a small space. Manageable however. We had ordered a few things from room service and it was delivered promptly. I wish they had more of an option for certain areas, and prices were a little high but it was expected. Location was perfect! Literally 1 minute away from the Aquarium!

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: puff007NewEngland
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the best I've tried in Boston thusfar. The hotel lobby is newly redone and is very sharp. Customer service and detail to attention is 5 star. Rooms are 3 star. They were average size. My room had leftover piece of food on a room service menu which was a little gross. Their restaurant breakfast was very pricey, next time I'd walk to a different place. The valet people were great and very consultative. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: signchic
Reviews.Content: During a work project in Boston, decided to stay over for Thanksgiving. The incredible thanksgiving feast left us with a feeling that nothing was missed. The room was large enough to be comfortable with a small child, and the nanny service was exceptional. Many wonderful historical sites, shops, dining and entertainment surround this area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ZenRider
Reviews.Content: Having lived on Boston not too long ago I prefer the Long Wharf over any other. Super close to aquarium, harbor, Quincy Market and even North End. Never need the T from here. Legal Seafood and other nice places are literally at your door. Rooms are three star but view and location are five stars. Restaurant is good for breakfast but pricey and we'll skip next time. Fitness center is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just ideal - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: MattSwitz
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in, great and nicely equipped as well as modern (new?) room on the first floor, extremely comfy bed, terribly clean, super city view, next to the subway, easy and short walk in to the city centre, lovely breakfast and kind personnel. Well do i really need to mention anything more? Whenever in Boston we will know our hotel address, thats for sure :-).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: illian420
Reviews.Content: The location can't get better than this... views of the harbor, less than 5 min walk to the harbor and the acquarium. The rooms are cozy with comfortable beds. My only complaint is that the bathroom's a little tight and I disliked the double doors for it. But it wasn't something I couldn't handle. We were in a room with 2 double beds. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Long Wharf is THE BEST hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: Bechego
Reviews.Content: I must say I am impressed with the Marriott Long Wharf once again. It is located right next to an entrance for the train. It is also located right next to the Aquarium and Legal Seafoods and is a short walking distance from other great Boston spots. And, best of all, they offer just about the best service I have experienced this side of the Mississippi! Maybe even the country. Yeah, I am referring to Marriott brands only, since that is my preferred brand. Marriott has been good to me for over six years of business travel. Yesterday, Mark, one the of the building security employees, was extremely helpful in my trying to locate a phone charger, since I forgot mine at home. Secondly, I am always impressed with the Long Wharfâ€™s Concierge Lounge, but today I was blown away by the chocolate covered strawberry chocolate cake. It is definitely the BEST cake I have had this fall. I wish my mouth had been bigger, and my clothes were not so tight already. It was simply delicious and I must compliment those who made it. Wow! Everyone at the Long Wharf â€œgetsâ€� customer service. As critical as I can be sometimes when I rate customer service at hotels, I can tell you that everyone at this hotel is simply stellar. Plain and simple, some other Marriott hotels, like some full-service Marriotts in New York City, can stand to learn from the way they do business at the Long Wharf. It goes to show that you can indeed be a nice hotel even if you are in the mean (east) coast. Really, New York City full-service Marriotts have no excuse. Send the management to the Boston Marriott Long Wharf to learn. Kuddos to the Long Wharf because they are doing it right! Even the lady delivering little square chocolates at about 4:30 PM was delightful! Also, the housekeeping employee said hi to me with a big smile when she first saw me this morning. I mean, everyone was amazing. Some might take it from granted, but I try hard not to. I am very impressed. The Long Wharf Marriott in Boston will be my preferred hotel every time I come to Boston, period!

Reviews.Title: “Decent lodging, great location”
Reviews.Author: tomspottiswood
Reviews.Content: Room was decent, with a great view of the park and harbor. Room was clean, quiet and roomy. Internet connection was fine, tv big. Conference rooms were really good, big but comfortable. The aquarium was close, enjoyed the tour. Close to the airport. Gym was adequate, with new equipment. Staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location for First Time to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: DachsieGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Boston Long Wharf on the way to visit family for 2 days/1 night at the end of September. They have a bit of construction at the front entrance but other than that, it's a lovely hotel. The lobby, hallways and rooms are very nice and clean with pleasing decor. It has a light contemporary feel to the place with a degree of classiness. We had a partial view of the wharf which was great. Staff we interacted with were very polite and friendly; from the maid to the front desk to the concierge. (He had fabulous recommendations for eating establishments and we followed them all to our satisfaction.) This location is close to EVERYTHING first time travelers to Boston would like to visit. And Starbucks is in the first floor lobby (if this is important to you...and it is to me!) We will stay here again when we travel to Boston. Can't wait to visit Boston again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unsafe for toddlers”
Reviews.Author: coleus1
Reviews.Content: I have been to this location before children a number of times. However, did not realize how unsafe the inner balcony design was until my 22 months old son tried to climb. We almost lost him, I just turned around for 2 seconds to open the hotel door when I saw him half way up on the balcony. There is no safety measure built under, so it's a straight drop to a few floor down. It was a scary experience. Tried to write and talk to someone in the hotel regarding this matter but no one seemed to notice or care. Also, there were a lot of drunken people being very loud outside the corridor in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but pricey and beds not so comfy”
Reviews.Author: BryceFarmView
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and even better staff. But we do have to say, lack luster beds (not up to normal Marriott standards we have come to expect) and beefy priced. We did take advantage of accumulated points and promotions - but were less then impressed w/ property appointments. We were warned of "under construction" status - but our concerns were outside of construction. upon our next visit to Boston, we will consider alternative location for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel- nasty pool”
Reviews.Author: businessmom21
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in Boston and had a nice stay at the Long Wahrf except for our visit to the pool. There was a couple having intercourse IN THE POOL. It was too bad- really ruined the pool experience to say the least. I have spent lots of time in New Orleans and never has this happened there, so I certainly didn't expect it in Boston when my family went to the pool for an evening swim. Eeewww is all I can say. I think they were too drunk to be embarrassed- and after we yelled at them to "get a room" they just went out to the deck to finish what had been interrupted. Yuk.

Reviews.Title: “No better way to see Boston”
Reviews.Author: dontknowhowshedoesit
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying - I live in Boston... and yes, I stay here. Whenever I can. - When we come into town with the kids - we stay here. - When we have friends visiting for the weekend - they stay here. - When I have clients in town - I put them up here. There is simply no other place to stay in Boston that provides a family friendly atmosphere, flawless business amenities, great dining options (on site!), a phenomenal location (access to EVERYTHING via the T) and super friendly service. The front desk and concierge staff will exceed your expectations and the rooms are twice the size of any other brand-name downtown hotel. If the fact that the entire hotel is shaped like a ship doesn't impress you, its copious amenities surely will. :)

Reviews.Title: “Location was awesome! T-station was right outside our door!”
Reviews.Author: MySeaBiscuit13
Reviews.Content: Access to freedom trail and T-station for transportation was excellent. You are only 2 stops on the T from the airport. Very easy to get to. My only complaint is that the guy at the front desk talked me into eating at the Marriott restaurant when I said I wanted clam chowder and I was going to go to Legal Seafood. The Marriott clam chowder was not that good. But otherwise I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: MeanderingCows
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Marriott Long Whart for a couple of nights for a work/leisure trip - one of us worked while the other one played tourist ;) The hotel is located right by the water and close to Fanueil Hall Marketplace. There are a LOT of shops and restaurants within walking distance. It is close to Northend and, trust me, you are going to want to go back to that area especially for the cannolis at Mike's Pastry (yum!) Note about Mike's Pastry: the shop is crowded but do not be intimidated; it is well worth it but I guess I should write a separate review about this place..... Since the lobby is located on the second level, it had a rather odd "sense of entry" into the hotel. There was some construction going on during our stay and it can get loud in the daytime. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffets at the Waterline restaurant located on the lobby floor were good - not great but good if you want the convenience of a decent breakfast. Our special thanks to Alex from security for administering first aid due to a sprained ankle and for the cannolis!!! You made us feel most welcome during our stay at the Marriot Long Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mikeweil
Reviews.Content: A nice conversion job here of what I guess was an old warehouse. A bit industrial but that is due to its size and maybe felt that way because it was a busy night we stayed. Nice fairly spacious rooms but not so great bathroom products. Liked the bar, the man did a mean vodka martini. Helpful service from all concierge to barman. No complaints and would stay again. Plenty going on in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Broder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on the Wharf. We were on the concierge floor and the concierge lounge has huge picture windows that look onto the water. The views from both the lounge and our room were beautiful. The hotel is located next to the Boston Acquarium and the IMAX theatre, is a close walk to Boston North area and is near the Freedom Trail. Location is great. The check in for the hotel is located on the second level. Rooms had the typical great Marriott bedding with very comfortable beds. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. I always think Marriott could improve the quality of its toiletries, and this hotel was no exception. Serve was excellent. We were allowed both an early check in and a late check out, as we were at the hotel during Hurricane Irene. This accommodation was very beneficial in light of canceled fligths and inclement weather. The appetizers, drinks and desserts in the concierge lounge were plentiful and of good quality. One of the reasons I prefer Marriott's with a concierge lounge is I love being able to go in and obtain a diet coke, a bottle of water, a piece of fruit etc., throughout the day without spending $5 from a mini bar for a diet coke. Would definitely return if in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: L Y
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property undergoing renovation, but don't let that stop you from experiencing it. The concierge lounge far, far exceeded our expectations. The concierge with the "keys" on his lapel was world-class. Even the housekeeping staff was pleasant and attentive to details. They even have an employee at the bottom of the escalator acting as a concierge-at-large. WHAT SERVICE! I cannot wait to stay at this property once the renovations are complete. LOVE this Marriott property. Plus, the trolley and the T station are both right at the property's edge, so location is prime. $$$ but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JimyDavid_8
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Close to Water Taxi or subway, T-Blue line to and from Logan airport. The Aquarium, Faneuil Hall Marketplace,and the freedom trail. The room is typical Marriott quality with a nice harbor view. It appears some construction and upgrading is in process. This, however, did not affect our stay. The Staff is very professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great first visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: There is so much to experience in Boston, that it's a good idea to stay where the action is within walking distance for the best chance to step out of your hotel and be exactly in the right place. The rooms are nice, the hotel restaurant has a delicious breakfast buffet and great view of the boats in the harbour, and you can walk in just about any direction for great fun and history.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family location!”
Reviews.Author: sweeney1121
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two young children and had a blast! You can walk to everything including the aquarium, children's museum, and a playground like 500 yards away on the way to Joe's american grill! The pubs within walking distance were also very kid friendly. The views from the restaurant within the hotel during brunch were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Tarashop23
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time staying at this Marriott. We stay in Boston quite often, but usually dont stay right down on the water. We had the kids and thought this would be fun. This hotel is wonderful, right across the street from teh aquariam, shopping, and food vendors. Parking was also very, very easy as they will valet everything. It was surprisingly easy to get to, but we knew how to avoid the traffic. We did see some of the notes regarding the construction, but to be honest, we never heard a thing. Looking forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf for a business meeting and was there for a couple days. The location is wonderful and the hotel is nice. If your looking for a nice hotel that is right on the water, this should definitely be a consideration. The staff was friendly, the rooms were nice and the view from my room was wonderful. From the hotel, you can walk to almost anywhere. Faneuil Hall & Quincy Market are only a short walk away (2 of my favorite places). All in all, a very nice place to stay! I would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's location on the Boston Harbor. We took a water taxi from the airport ($10 per person) directly to our hotel, which was definitely the easiest way to get there (yes, even with luggage). The staff was very helpful. Our room was clean. We had a downtown facing room. You are a short walk away from Boston's famous North End neighborhood where you will find amazing Italian Food. You're also very close to Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall. There is a blue line subway station right outside the doors of this hotel. However, just know that the green line is what you will need most of the time (to Fenway, Prudential Center, the theatre district), and the closest place to catch it is several blocks west of the hotel at Government Center. Give yourself 10 minutes to walk there comfortably. You can take the blue line from Aquarium Station to Government Center as well if you don't mind taking multiple trains. The pool was very nice and overlooked the harbor. My biggest complaint here is not the construction that is currently taking place, but the business center computers. They freeze constantly and are frustrating to use. The bottom line is that this is a great hotel with great views, and is appropriate for any type of trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Msreeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over labor day weekend with my husband and two kids (12 & 7). Yes, the hotel is undergoing renovations, no it did not affect our stay. The hotel is very nice, there was no noise, the entrance was clearly marked and easy to get to. The location can not be beat - on the wharf, across the street from Quincy Market and a short walk to the North end. A few tips; upgrade your room to include the breakfast package. A few dollars more gets you two adult breakfasts and kids are free. It is a breakfast buffet with everything you could ask for (omelet station, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage, potatoes, fruit, oatmeal, yogurt, pastries, etc.) I even got a latte to go! Don't miss the pool and outdoor deck overlooking the harbor. It was a great spot to eat a snack or even dinner. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The only negative we could find was the charge for internet. Just doesn't seem possible for Marriott to be able to get away with that in these times. But we would stay here again in a heartbeat! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: lizmit
Reviews.Content: My very generous cousin used her Marriott points toward our overnight at the Marriott Long Wharf. We'd never been to Boston before and were absolutely delighted to find the hotel RIGHT next to the water taxi dock from the airport. Check in was a breeze, the room was nice and roomy and what an amazing location! We dropped our bags in the room and headed out to get dinner. Stopped in an Irish pub to have a beer, walked around Quincy Market, then ate at Legal Seafood (separate review) which was excellent. All within blocks of the hotel! After a good nights sleep we packed up and headed down to the restaurant for breakfast which was unbelievably expensive ... don't waste your money there. Our breakfast of 2 coffees, 2 o.j., bagel & lox for husband and eggs benedict for me came to $57.00 plus tip! The english muffin that my eggs were on top of was so hard to saw through that I didn't eat it. Other than the expensive and disappointing breakfast I would highly recommend this hotel for its comfortable room and very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and atmosphere, but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Baltan
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, because the location was convenient and the facility was well maintained. The only thing frustrated me was the loud voice outside at midnight, somebody shouting after getting drunk.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy - Stay away”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsQuiteARide
Reviews.Content: Terrible place to stay in the summer. There are large outdoor bars on both sides of the hotel that you can clearly hear from the guest rooms. We were on the top floor (7), and could hear the din of the crowd above the noise of our air conditioner. We're in our late 30s, and it still disrupted our sleep. The noise doesn't quiet down until about 12:30 or 1:00am. Big disappointment. I'd stay elsewhere if I were you

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Front Heaven”
Reviews.Author: nicki2259
Reviews.Content: In the heart of it all ! This hotel has a location that can't be beat for us. We like to come in for a weekend and enjoy some of the sights and fantastic restaurants Boston is known for. The new greenway is fantastic to walk along and Fanueil Hall is just across the street. Catch the ferry (next door) to the harbor islands or walk on up to the North End for dinner. The hotel itself was undergoing a renovation the last time we were there so I am sure the next time we arrive it will be even more beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “one night was enough”
Reviews.Author: Cavi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing to write home about. The rooms were pretty average for a higher-end hotel, although the beds were very comfortable. The service was okay. The water in the bathtub did not drain. They did send someone at midnight to repair it and everything was better in the morning. The location is good. There's a lot to do right there. Plus, it is only steps away from the Blue line which you can take to the airport, only 2 stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, 3.5 stars, under construction”
Reviews.Author: Welltraveled38
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was lovely actually. The location on the wharf and across the street from Quincy Market is awesome. We could WALK to the freedom trail, children's museum, and through Boston Commons, china town and north end from the hotel. Parking is valet for $44 a day (in and out as much as you want), or $35 across the street in a garage. Kids loved the warm pool each night, Chocolate Chip cookies in the lobby upon our arrival, and fresh fruit in the morning. Restaurant was good (not amazing, but fairly priced). Concierge helpful, nice spaces in the lobby. A long-lined Starbucks in the basement. Overall a great stay. The hotel is under construction so the entrance looks like a mess, however there was NO JACKHAMMERING during my stay. The front desk told me that is all over. I asked for a quiet room (due to the open lobby/reception/banquet style of the hotel to the rooms). I was glad-they put me on the end (above the very popular restaurant outside) and it was very quiet. Good workout facilities that have just been redone. The sailboats on the wharf are a beautiful view. There is a refrigerator and coffee maker in the room. Bathroom was smaller in size but beautiful/updated as was room.

Reviews.Title: “Good all around”
Reviews.Author: ABAinCA
Reviews.Content: The facility is well maintained, clean, with all the extras you expect from a quality hotel. Wonderful location near the water and easy access to the Freedom Trail. The staff was universally helpful. We had need of a handicap room with a view for the family member who would be spending a day in the room. The room was perfect. It had a view of the city and a full access shower. The room was quality in all regards. The only issue is that the handicap room is the farthest room from the elevator and it is a very long hallway. During the renovation I would recommend putting the handicap rooms near the elevators. If we had know the parking was about $45 dollars a day we would have postponed renting the car until we left the city. We all thought that was a little expensive for guests of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sheri W
Reviews.Content: While the location is ideal for wanting to be able to walk around downtown Boston, go the aquarium, and be near the park, the hotel was undergoing construction which was very disruptive and loud and made entering & exiting the hotel a nightmare. The ONE public restroom near the restaurant always had a line of at least 12 woman waiting to utilize the facilities. The room itself was comfortable, and the view was okay from the window. I did not find the staff very patient or helpful, although they were polite.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Picturesque and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: aelau
Reviews.Content: We took the kids to Boston for a sightseeing weekend to kick off summer break. I debated whether to reserve two rooms or pile into one room. We have one pre-teen and two teenagers. I ended up reserving one room and requesting a roll away. We arrived very late on our arrival day (nearly midnight) and were relieved the roll away was already in our room. The hotel was under renovation, so felt compartmentalized and rather plain, but the cleaning staff added her own sense of sparkle to our stay which dramatically improved our opinion of the hotel. (Smiles, fresh towels, spotless room, etc...) The location was picturesque and easy. You can hop on the T literally right outside the door and there were dining options within steps of the hotel. One evening, our tired kids grabbed dinner across the street at Quincy Market and headed back to the hotel while my husband and I had a leisurely dinner at Legal Seafoods, also across the street. We did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, but found it convenient and comfortable for our stay. Positives: location, comfortable beds, excellent staff. Negatives: a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chilypepah
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better! There's a beautiful park with free entertainment on summer days. The hotel was in the process of some renovations. The construction did not create any problems during our stay. The room was very clean and well appointed. There was a small fridge and safe within the room. The view of the park, and the harbor was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST FUN”
Reviews.Author: MIKESILVESTRI
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have used this hotel and it is by far one of the best destinations in the USA. I knew there was some renovations going on so a little noisy but I put the kids down stairs. The staff is great and always helpful. I wish i could remember the managers name (big baseball fan) but extremly helpful. Near all the great spots, a quick T ride to Fenway, great food in the area and great energy every where you go. Ill be back again and again! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: DougPatrice
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - easy access to public transportation, historic sites, and restaurants. Rooms were nice - housekeeping prompt. Construction and renovation while we stayed - sometimes noisy, but nothing to deter me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: la2011
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 2 children ages 10 and 13. The hotel was exactly what I expected based on prior reviews. It is the perfect location for the vacation traveler. The hotel is running at 98% occupancy so though I am a platinum member I wasn't upgraded because we checked in at midnight and they didn't have any upgraded rooms available. The concierge lounge is the busiest I've ever been to. Still, it was pleasant. We took the trolley/harbor boat tour, which turned out to be great. I'd recommend it. Legal seafoods is across the street along with many other restaurants. The Parker House (best Boston cream pie) is within walking distance. Once the construction is complete this will be a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: caryon1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has normal amenities that you would expect of a Marriott - not really much more of less. The big draw is the location. You are in the heart of the tourist attractions and can walk to almost everything. If you need transportation, the "T" subway system stops right outside the hotel. Perfect location for tourists. The hotel has some construction going on right now, but the hotel did a good job minimizing the disruption.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it. It's a tourist trap.”
Reviews.Author: colombian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive. At $400+ a night you don't get what you get at a Courtyard. its old and it smells. There may be a newer area in this hotel but I don't even want to know how much it costs. The location is great but there are a lot of options in the vicinity to give them this amount of money. I was in a business trip and I don't do my own booking otherwise I would never stay here even if it is on the company expense account. This hotel is a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the high price”
Reviews.Author: riodoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Paid extra to stay on the concierge level and was sorely disappointed. Hoped to avoid the usual 'cattle call' of continental breakfast at other hotels but this was actually worse. Concierge room was way too small for the amount of people who had access (which I think was half of the hotel- people were coming from other floors) and the offerings were meager. On both mornings the coffee urn was empty (although it was refilled promptly after asking) and there were not enough seats. The room was adequate and clean and did have a very nice view. The location is great for sightseeing. I probably would noot choose to stay here again though because the general vibe was a bit too crowded and hectic. Didn't feel as though I were staying in the level of hotel I was paying the price for!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: LalaB94
Reviews.Content: The location is the real draw here. You are just a few minutes easy walk from the most popular sights. The aquarium is next door, and many of the sightseeing boats are docked on Long Wharf. The North End with lots of great restaurants is also an easy walk. This was the best thing about the hotel. Overall the hotel is pretty nice. Rooms have been recently updated, but are standard issue Marriott decor. I swear they use the exact same furniture in every hotel. The bathroom in our particular room was nice enough but tiny. There was no way for two people to be in the bathroom at once, which could be tough for a family. In fact one person would barely have room to move. The entire hotel is being renovated as other reviewers have noted. The lobby itself looked almost done, but there is still a lot of very noisy work going on. Think jackhammers at 8am. Speaking of noise, there is one huge problem with the hotel's design in this regard. This is what would make me not come back. The hotel is built with a center atrium that tends to funnel noise up into the rooms. We were on the 4th floor and while inside the room I could hear clinking china and normal conversation from a meeting on the ground floor. I could only imagine the noise from something like a wedding. Not what I'd want late at night after a busy day of sightseeing. Overall the property is fine, but think carefully about your needs and the sort of schedule you would keep. There are a lot of other hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: spin4lyf
Reviews.Content: We checked in after a long drive from Maine. The reservations attendant was rude and short with me. I was quoted a rate a few minutes before arriving to the hotel by Marriott.com. The front desk gentleman argued with me. I had to call central back on my cell phone to prove to him the rate was available. He didn't even apologize. We ended up taking our own bags to our room....not sure where the bellman was. The hotel is undergoing major construction, and it's a HUGE mess. I can't believe they are asking for $359/night for what looks like a low end Holiday Inn. Perhaps when the rennovations are complete the hotel will be better, but right now, STAY AWAY! The concierge floor was horrible. We went for breakfast after a little late, as they were cleaning up, they were unwilling to let my boys have even a box of cereal. The whole thing was not a great experience. The only good part of the hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location but under Construction!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine59
Reviews.Content: We would not have booked this hotel had we known there was active construction underway. Arrived on a Thursday and stayed on the concierge floor. The lounge there had a beautiful view of the new and improved harbor but only 10 tables. We were given a room by the elevators, which were very very slow, and asked to be moved and are very glad that we did. We were at the opposite side of the hotel from the lounge and it was fairly quiet. The lounge was to small to accommodate the crowds for breakfast and even though we paid to stay on the floor we had to eat else where or in our rooms. The room was remodeled and clean. Bathroom is small but worked. Expected much more for the price we paid..over looking Columbus Park and the Rose Kennedy parkway. Around the corner from the aquarium and all the tour boats leave from the pier right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boz151
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in many hotels around Boston, mainly in the Faneuil and Harbor Front areas. Usually it is just my wife and I, but this time we had our three children with us ages 6-9. The Marriott Long Wharf was great, the staff was friendly and accommodating, even putting us in a larger room when they saw the five of us show up (rather than use a roll out bed). The pool was great for the kids, and the location can't be beaten. Across the street from Faneuil Hall and many shops/food etc. And the wharf area is great, kids can feed the striped bass that come in school into the wharf area. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva25
Reviews.Content: Seeking a convenient location to Quincy Market and activities, we stayed here on our last night of vacation. The hotel is under construction but they had someone there to guide you where to go at all times. We were able to check in very early. Unfortunately the room we were given was right above the outdoor bar area which was very loud on a Saturday night. We called the front desk around midnight to see how late the bar would be hopping and when we got our bill in the morning, they had comped us half the cost! We were very impressed with the management. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. But the location is the best thing about this hotel (besides the Starbucks in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: nadarien
Reviews.Content: location: it was a bit of a walk from here to the public transportation. maybe we missed the shortcut? there's a Legal Seafood resto which is walking distance, and there's starbucks at the lobby. there's also a nice view of the wharf hotel: felt a little stuffy, this is more of a business hotel than a family hotel. the room was a typical nice hotel room. parking wasn't free so that's something to consider if you brought a car. overall: would opt to find another hotel closer to downtown

Reviews.Title: “Not what one would expect from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Mochi02
