Reviews.Content: The Marriott Long Wharf has long been one of my favorite hotels. As a Marriott Rewards member for over 20 years, Marriott is always my first choice for quality service and properties. The Long Wharf has undergone renovations and while it looks modern the level of service Marriott has been known for is missing. The people don't seem to go the extra step to make you feel welcome here. The new reception area is quite small and in the middle of the entrance to the restaurant. This make the area very congested. Having used rewards points our room was lovely. A large room on the sixth floor with large windows overlooking the marina. The windows however were filthy! Little hand prints all over. Kind of hard to miss from even the most rushed housekeeper.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!! Only stay here if you like false promises!”
Reviews.Author: jegan212
Reviews.Content: Readers, I severly warn you to never stay here!! I booked my rate online, went down, to Boston checked in, everything looked ok.... The next morning they had raised my rate $200 and refused to lower it even though I had the confirmation email!! I will never stay here ever or any other Marriott if possible because of their total lack of responsibility. It has been almost two months and I am still trying to find a way to get them to honor the rate booked!

Reviews.Title: “Location amazing - Rooms & service just so-so”
Reviews.Author: hurleybea
Reviews.Content: Loved the location - I was travelling with my daughters and their 4 young sons - we had adjoining rooms which were convenient, but the rooms and bathrooms were rather small - the large windows with terrific views of the pier and harbor made the rooms feel larger. A stone's throw from the Aquarium and Duck Boats - the kids & adults loved both. Within walking distance to the North End for great Italian restaurants & bakeries, Faneuil Hall for shopping & a 'Food Court' that the boys enjoyed, and the historic sites and parks of Boston. We knew there would be construction when we booked, but the open atrium of the hotel makes for very loud construction noises seemingly everywhere/at all times. The service was aloof, most seemed not to really want to assist - parking was rather pricey at $40/day. I think I would return for the convenience and uniqueness of the location, just wish the overall service would have reflected a desire to want my return!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tjb30b
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Long Wharf was a great choice for our getaway weekend stay. Location is super - very close to North End, Quincy Market, Aquarium and harbor. Rooms were large and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: sthomas0616
Reviews.Content: Booked this reservation months in advance because we were planning a family get-together and wanted to be close to ALL THE ATTRACTIONS Boston has to offer - true, the location of this Marriott is wonderful for everything in the area but, I've stayed at quite a few Marriotts (being a platinum member) and this one is just "okay" - nothing special! Our floor was right in the midst of renovations so the noise level was pretty bad and they appeared to start pretty early in the morning so that did not lend itself to sleeping late and their concierge staff were extremely rude and condescending to my family (including asking them 3x if they logged the drinks they were taking from the bar) and the food in the restaurant was nothing to write home about. On the plus side is the fact that it is next door to the Aquarium, the dock where all the boats leave from, the North End and Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market so......I would recommend it if you intend on visiting any one of those areas (all within a short walk) but I would definitely wait for the construction to end because, as I mentioned earlier, the noise factor is bad. As Marriotts go - this one should get more than a renovation to the property - try some of the staff as well. One last word - the front desk staff were extremely accomodating (since we needed some extra service during check-in) and worked on our reservation over 40 minutes so.....kudo's to her!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sailladyHHI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 5 nights in June with our children and grandchildren. Perfect Location. We were able to get adjoining rooms that both had double beds. Awesome waterviews from rooms. Beautiful pool. Next door to aquarium, Imax and water ferries. Restaurants with walking distance. Remodeling project was NOT a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Just average!!”
Reviews.Author: MJ525
Reviews.Content: In May stayed in the Long Wharf for one night. I was in town for an early birthday celebration. We had 5 guys in our group so we had two rooms. The beds were comfortable as always. Nothing tops a Marriott bed. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is right in the heart of the fun. The hotel was just ok though. I did not find anything real great about it. The rooms are built around what i assume is the open ballroom. It was a large carpeted area. The night we stayed there, it happened to be hosting a prom. Not a problem for us because we were out at the bars, but the noise coming from that open ballroom would have been disturbing to people staying in. After a late night we came in and got to sleep on those comfy beds....the only problem was we were woken up at 7:30 in the morning to the sound of the crew setting up the ballroom for another event. All you could hear was talking and the clanging of dishes and silver. we were on the third floor, so i could not imagine how loud it was for the lower floors. It may have been a busy weekend we happened to be there for but it was a bit disappointing. For the money, i think there are probably better options. The rooms were adequate though and again i love the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelpro231
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and wanted something close to the docks since I was going to the Cape via the fast ferry. The hotel is under a major renovation but understand that all properties go through this. The staff was very helpful and friendly; from check-in to the bellhops who happily helped you with your bags. Room had a great view facing the Italian North End toward the old North Church and was perhaps a bit quieter. Had a room with 2 double beds and was very comfortable. Especially liked the in-room safe where you could store valuables. Did not experience the dining room or other amenities in the hotel other than room service. For the convenience and location, would make this a place to stay on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “The best feature of the hotel is its location”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: We were attending an event at this hotel, so it seemed like the most convenient location. And the location is VERY good for downtown Boston -- at least if you don't have to park a car at nosebleed prices. A free airport shuttle bus, then two stops on the "T" subway train and you can get from terminal to hotel in less than 30 minutes for $1.70 with a "Charlie" card. But that's probably the only good deal about this hotel. By any objective standard, you pay a lot for, well, not very much. Hotel prices in Boston are just very expensive, so don't expect good value. The worst feature about the hotel is its atrium design, as noise can be a big problem. If you're sensitive to noise, beg for a room off the atrium. With a lower floor room on the atrium, some idiot (or a party) WILL wake you up in the middle of the night. Not so great if you're paying $300/night to stay here. In addition to easy airport access, you are right on the waterfront, next to the (expensive) aquarium, and very convenient and highly walkable to Boston's historic sights. Prices for everything in the area are expensive, except for the Haymarket fruit market, which sets up a couple blocks from the hotel on Fridays and Saturdays. A must see for local color and very cheap fruit/veggies. And even if the market is not running, I'd recommend the pizza shop on that street. $1.25 a slice, instead of the $4 you'll pay in Quincy Market, for very good pizza. As noted, the hotel is currently undergoing renovations, and the main restaurant was closed during our stay (they fed us breakfast in a ballroom). Food and beverage in the hotel are fine, but not exceptional. Better if you're paying with somebody else's money. Architecture and public spaces are a bit outdated and not stylish. Rooms were small for the price paid, but reasonably comfortable (small bathrooms without real doors a bit annoying). The staff -- like most folks in Boston -- were friendly. Bottomline is that this is an expensive, mediocre hotel. I'd recommend looking for something better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, newly renovated, great service”
Reviews.Author: eadj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected Boston and the Marriott Long Wharf for our anniversary weekend, and we were not disappointed. Boston is a beautiful city with much to recommend it. The Marriott is perfectly located on an historic wharf on Boston Harbor near the Aquarium and the commercial ferry lines out to the Boston Harbor Islands (now national park and well worth a trip). It is also very close to the Faneuil Hall area with its street performers, pushcarts and shops, and a short walk to the many superb Italian restaurants and pastry shops of the North End. Other than breakfast, we did not eat at the hotel as the main restaurant and bar are nearing completion of a major renovation, but we got a peek at the new bar which is scheduled to open very soon, and it looks very modern with gorgeous views of the harbor. The staff is great. Informed that it was our anniversary, the hotel provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine, cheese, crackers, and fruit and a location on the concierge floor. The lounge there offers not only magnificent views of the harbor, but breakfast, afternoon appetizers, and evening desserts. The pool on the third floor is not large, but certainly adequate, with a very large outdoor patio overlooking the harbor. Valet parking is expensive at $44 per day, but extends to 6 pm on the day of checkout, which is a big advantage if you intend to spend that day exploring the city. We will look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Hold your booking until construction is over”
Reviews.Author: JohanNoordzij
Reviews.Content: When travelling we usually stay in one of the Marriott family hotels with good experience. However, we found the experience at Marriott Long Wharf below Marriott standards. At time of booking (early June) it mentioned construction was to be finished by mid May 2011. Big surprise to find out at checking in that construction was far from over. First morning 7:10 AM we woke up at the sound of heavy construction machinery... Unacceptable! We were moved to another section of the hotel which was far less noisy, but ..... why put guests in rooms so close to the construction in the first place when other rooms are available??? Besides the construction sounds, the hotel is built in such a manner that the noise from public area below, lobby and/or events areas cannot be blocked from most rooms. That means when in your room you will certainly hear kids running around and doors being shut(throughout the night!). We were 'forced' to enjoy the music of a wedding taking place in the events area and sounds of breakfast taking place in that same area since the restaurant was temporarily under construction. Finally, service is courteous but certainly not friendly or warm. Rooms are spacious, neat and housekeeping is good. Marriott: Yes! Boston Marriott Longwharf: No!!

Reviews.Title: “Work in progress”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Hotlanta
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel when it was undergoing some renovation (painting, etc.) and it was pretty much a mess around the entry and lobby area. Except for the smell of paint, the rooms were fine and had a good view out onto the water. In general, I understand that hotels need to refresh periodically, but the staff were oblivious to the fact that it created some inconvenience and less than a fully desirable situation for guests, and they did nothing to try and alleviate these inconveniences. If the renovation is done, I'd try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DHK44
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location: next to Legal Seafood restaurant, across the street from the Quincy Market, on the harbor, you can get there by Water Taxi from the airport and the Aquarium subway stop is at the front door. We had a room on the second floor without windows (rare) but they then provided us with access to the Concierge floor which meant free breakfast, snacks and dessert. There may be more elegant rooms elsewhere but who goes to Boston to stay in a hotel room? They do charge $13/day for internet service, something that is becomming more typical.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Long Wharf”
Reviews.Author: KalluDada
Reviews.Content: A best 5 star non-smoking hotel located donwtown Boston. A minute walk to Quincy Market & Banknorth garden. Situated on south harbour right next to city's Financial district and right opposite to Whale watch and Aquarium. Rooms are quite specious, neat and very clean. Surrounded by beautiful garden. Swimming pool and fitness centre are really cool, staff is very friendly. Added advantages are it has a Starbucks right in the lobby and is right next to a T-stop for convenient access around the city. South station is a minute walk away that makes best place for business peoples. Check-in & Check-out were really easy thanks to the staff of Long Warf.

Reviews.Title: “Not Safe!”
Reviews.Author: Alayna10511
Reviews.Content: I was very much looking forward to staying at this property. I work in the business, so I understand how hotels operate. Check in was very nice, the staff was friendly and helpful to me and my guests. The room was fine, nothing more or less than expected. The hotel was under construction, but still was kept neat. My problem came later on in the evening. The hotel reservation was in my name only, so you would think that I would be the only once accessible to room keys (for security reasons.) I went out for the night with a few friends, and came back to someone else sleeping in my bed! (The person was a friend of mine who knew I was staying at the hotel, but I was not planning on them staying. It wasnâ€™t even a friend that I went out with, or knew my room number!) I went to the front desk and asked why someone besides me was given keys to the room and they said they had security bring them up. Regardless, I was very unhappy that this whole thing happened (for obvious safety reasons!!!) I was given no apology while I was expressing my concern.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: dmarino96
Reviews.Content: I have to agree that it was noisy, we were woken up to the sounds of silverware clanking from a big common room. The contruction noise we expected but not the extraneous noise. I usually stay at the Millenium Boston, which is also a great location, and you can bet that I will next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel with even worse service”
Reviews.Author: MBRB1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on April 2nd and my husbands debit card was charged in error. I called to rectify this situation (as well as sending an email), and it was taken care of, albeit about a week later. Last Saturday I noticed that we had been charged again. I called and spoke to someone named Ryan who was supposedly a manager. He told me that although he was not able to reverse the charge, that he would ensure that it was taken care of on Monday when their accounting department was open. He was not able to tell me why we had been charged a month after our stay, but did acknowledge that it was their error. Of course, it was not. I called back again and was made to hold twice, for 10-15 minutes each time. I was told that because I do not have the card # and expiration date of my husband (who I cannot reach because he is in another state and about to be deployed with the military) that nothing can be done without the card number. COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE!!! Not to mention untrue. Apparently this is how this hotel makes money - by taking money that does not belong to them, along with hiring sub-par help (leading to HORRENDOUS customer service), and charging outrageous prices. I would also like to mention that our room was uncomfortably hot, and smelled like smoke. Never again will I stay at one of your hotels, and I assure you that the military families in the area will also never patronize any of your hotels either. VERY disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for about a week. Aside from the minor annoyance of the lobby area being under construction, my stay was alright. The location can't be beat....walkable to so many attractions (aquarium, Faneuil Hall, Little Italy, etc) and it's great to be near the water. My only warning would be about the noise level...I am generally not too noise-sensitive, but I could hear everything: the maids in the hallway, people in the rooms next door, etc. Not to mention the air conditioning was quite loud when it would kick on. The rooms/beds are comfortable...typical Marriott style. For what it's worth, the restaurant/bar has a lovely view. I'd recommend this hotel if you want to be close to attractions and have the money to spend...but make sure to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL LOBBY UNDER CONSTRUCTION”
Reviews.Author: rollsy42
Reviews.Content: We had gotten a pretty good deal for this hotel-$199.00 per night/parking $43/night, and it is very centrally located, but boy is it noisy. construction activities start promptlly at 7:00 am, with the drills and hammers, topped off with the loud ferry boat honking nice and early as well. They gave us a very small room just above the lobby, which is currently undergoing construction. The lobby noise wafts upstairs so that it is basically a part of your room. The bathroom was okay, but also very small, no exhaust fan, low water pressure in shower. The room overlooked the dog park, which was cute, and again, it is right accross the street from the main attractions, the Quincy market, Freedom Trail, etc. The Starbucks was conveniently located in the lower portion of the lobby, and the service there was very good/no long lines to contend with. We ate at Clarke house (?) next door to the hotel and Tia's as well, which I may be spelling wrong, but we had delicious food and very good service at both places. You can bring small children to either of these places, they ahve kids menus. Aquarium is also right across the street, and was very nice but also very crowded and long, long lines-ps we stayed here on Easter break, so LOTS of little kids everywhere!! I saw an ad for a city pass which seemed like a good deal at about $46.00, which incl. a bunch of the main attractions in Boston. We had free tix to the acquarium, so we made out quite well. I would request a high-floor room at the marriot if you decide to stay there, at least till construction is completed! Call before booking! :) Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Too much chlorine!”
Reviews.Author: DMM79
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston with children who like to swim. Chlorine level in the pool was way too high. Kids had marks on skin, bathing suits faded, and hair congealed into tangled, chlorine-scented mess. It took days for the smell to get out of their hair. Renovation underway in hotel. Loud power tool started at 7 AM. Staff looking for handouts always. Great location. Not so nice on the inside!

Reviews.Title: “Usual Marriott, walk to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller550
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. It's right on the wharf, across the street from many attractions and shopping. While it's only two miles straight line from Logan, it takes 15 minutes by cab. Good food for breakfast and lunch. Being remodeled in March 2011. Completion scheduled for May-June 2011 Thin walls between rooms. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, phenomenal staff...and 7 day exec lounge!”
Reviews.Author: CA92
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend Marriott Long Wharf. Hadn't stayed there before. These guys just get it. Staff really make a place and everyone from the valets, to the check-in staff and concierge staff were just terrific. And it wasn't in a plastic way...just low key friendly and helpful. I have to give special mention to Jack Lyman in security and to the housekeeping member who found and turned in a favorite scarf I left in my room. Jack was an absolute pleasure to deal with and he sent fedexed out the scarf to me right away. Classy. Location is absolutely perfect, right on Boston's waterfront (unlike a lot of the other Boston hotels that have waterfront in their name), beside the Aquarium, Children's Museum, Financial district, North End (Italian), Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market etc. I've only ever stayed in the Copley area before. It's fine, but it's really suited to shoppers. This location was just better for an all round Boston experience. Clean, updated rooms with lovely bed linens. Free water in the fridge. Fruit and water all round the place (check in, gym/pool area) in fact. I'm a Marriott Platinum and was upgraded to a lovely suite on the concierge floor looking right out on the Aquarium. Ironically, this brings me the only slight negative. If you're in a room that ends with 24, 25, 28 or 29 I suspect that you will hear a lot of elevator noise. I was in a 29 room and it felt like the elevator shaft was just behind my pillow. It didn't stop me from sleeping though and I really appreciated the space and awesome view. If I was paying for the suite, I would probably have asked to switch to one further down the hall to avoid voices and mechanical noise. For you lounge afficionados. This place is a rarity in that the exec lounge (gold and plat rewards members) is open on the weekends too. Really nice continental breakfast with all kinds of toasts, pastries, boiled eggs, cold meats, fruits, cereals, juice etc and appetizers (free) and honor bar every evening. The best part...gorgeous view over-looking Boston harbor. This is a real oasis. It did tend to get quite busy with families on weekend mornings but no biggie. Some construction ongoing in lower level lobby off the street, but does not impact guests AT ALL. Check in area complete with full desk and comfy seats is one floor up on the escalator. Nice gym and pool (not huge...but all that you would need). Overall, this place had a very friendly vibe. It felt safe and secure and I would feel completely comfortable staying there on my own. There's a lot more happening around the area in summer (island ferries dock right outside) but there was still plenty to do and see in March. Parking is valet only and about $44 per day. It's expensive, but then again, so is Boston harbor real estate. You can go nearby for about $38/day but advantage of hotel is that you have 24 access to car and can come and go as you like. Internet was free for me as a plat, but I think it was $12.95 a day. Looked like there were free computers off the lobby though. Didn't use the on-site restaurant as the North End is a stone's throw away. Try Pomodoro's (booking highly advised as it only seats about 20 people). Yummy. This place can be pricey in high season, but if you're flexible there's deals to be had. I got an excellent rate using AAA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMom41
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled to Boston for spring break, this hotel was a great choice. Step outside and the Boston waterfront, Fanueil Hall and much more is right there. They are doing construction on the lobby areas which did not affect us at all and will be done soon. Lovely pool and hot tub, great views from our room and super nice staff. The price was more than I'd hoped to pay for this trip but all in all, it was worth it and the kids LOVED it (ages 8 and 12).

Reviews.Title: “not much to recommend”
Reviews.Author: billyclyde
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in March 2011. I travel to Boston several times a year, and decided to give this place a try. But other than the location, there is not much I can recommend about this place. This hotel is not inexpensive, and you should expect to pay for everything, including internet and parking. The location is OK if you want to be by the water. The hotel is undergoing a renovation, and there is no lobby to speak of. Unfortunately, they did not mention that on their website. Seems a bit deceptive to me. My room was in the rear of the hotel. The door of my room faced inward to a large open atrium. A couple of floors below was a dining area. The first night I was there, the dining area was hosting a banquet. With a large group of people, and a large open area with solid walls, and with the usual conversation level and clanging of dishes and silverware, it was quite noisy at night. Furthermore, the door to my room had a gap between the bottom of the door and the floor, which made for a lot noise at night when I was trying to get to sleep. Finally, I called the front desk about this situation, and was treated rudely and aggressively. Excuse me, but I was just trying to get some sleep, which I think is reasonable request and shouldn't cause such an unpleasant reaction on their part. Eventually I got up and rolled up a towel and put this in the crack of the door, which helped reduce the noise somewhat. The noise from the dining area was there in the morning during breakfast and again in the evening for dinner, but fortunately it wasn't as loud as it was that first night. Nevertheless, the abysmal attitude of their employees was something I won't forget. I'll be back in Boston a couple of weeks, but I won't be staying at the Marriott Long Wharf again.

Reviews.Title: “Close To Everything”
Reviews.Author: jengr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the people were really nice. We arrived early and were able to check into our room. The room was clean and cozy. The location was perfect, across the street is the Aquarium and then on the other side of the Hotel you have Faneuil Hall. The breakfast in the hotel restauran was amazing! Over all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: Missymom53
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times inthe past. The location next to Quincy Marketplace is great,but I have learned the rents have gone up and many of the quaint stores are gone with empty storefronts and high priced restaurant left. This hotel is going through major renovations. The escalator as you enter is nothing but plater board and the views from the restaurant are of balcony repairs yet the hostess insists on seating folks in the ugliest locations. Worst of all it seems call girls fill the rooms and all night long we heard the sounds of knocking on doors in the wee hours and other not so pleasant noises. Many guests were heard complaing they were not told of the repairs when booking. The one high point is the wondeful staff that do try their best to be pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay right downtown with easy access to subway”
Reviews.Author: nancybee
Reviews.Content: We took the subway ("T") from the airport and it couldn't have been easier. When you step out of the subway (at the aquarium stop) you are right in front of the hotel. Also you are very convenient to the aquarium (across the street) and 2 blocks to the Quincy Market with about 50 restaurants and pubs. Also is an easy walk to the North End/little Italy where Paul Revere's house is. It had snowed the day before we arrived but all the sidewalks were cleared and we walked everywhere with no problem. This hotel is in a perfect location for a first sightseeing trip to Boston. Yes it was cold but we bundled up and got out there. I was very surprised at the large number of tourists out doing the same thing. The hotel is very nice; public areas are undergoing renovation but it's no problem. Very comfortable beds! The thing that got me mad though was the $12.95 charge for wireless internet access in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location. Shame about porters.”
Reviews.Author: garnicholson
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in an excellent location right by the Harbour and near to the historic City centre. We got this one night stay for free by cashing in frequent user points, and as such were delighted by the nice room, which included flat-screen TV, iPod dock, nice furniture etc. We walked into the City for our evening meal. It is a shame we didn't have more time to explore this impressive and historic town. If you are a Brit like myself or European, be prepared for the "Classic" US Hotel experience at this place. By that I mean, when you park your car the valet wants a tip, when you try and pick up your bags you are intercepted by a porter, who wants a tip, then he summons another guy to take your stuff to your room, and he wants to prattle on about Florida and generally get in the way and then get a tip. When leaving, if you try and grab a luggage trolley yourself the girl on reception will try and tell you you aren't allowed to. If you ignore her reasoning that you are the customer and can do what you like, you will garner the hate-filled stares of the crowd of uniformed tip-vampires loitering around the entrance. And then you will still have to tip the valet to get your car back. I must say the tone and body language of the porting staff were generally condescending, and I feel cheated by effectively having to pay them to go away. To say again, this is a very smart hotel in a very good location. But you will be shelling out a constant stream of green-backs before you get any peace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lame hotel”
Reviews.Author: tphansen99
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on 12/28/10. Great location on the water, right near the North End, and short drive to Logan. Our stay however wasn't very good: super noisy hotel at all hours, too-small second floor lobby, waiting for crowded elevators, lame pool - plus in our room (#527) we could hear the elevators non-stop and the toilet was really dirty (yuck!). A nod though to Mike Barnes out front who was super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: sumanitu
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel 20 years ago and it left a lasting impression on me. So when I needed to attend a funeral in Brookline, the first place I looked into was the Long Wharf. My sons, 14 and 20, enjoyed the pool and exercise rooms. I enjoyed the much needed respite provided by the beautiful view of the marina speckled with sail boats and water taxis. The acquarium is right next door. The penguins are just adorable. At night we walked up to Faneuil Hall. The Sunday brunch was yummy - eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, cereal, blintzes, omlette station for about $17.50 pp. We ate hamburgers in the lounge one night while enjoying the football game. The hamburgers were dynamite. A special shout out of thanks goes to Jim the doorman. He went that extra mile making sure that I knew how to get to the funeral home and back to the Marriott. I would have been so lost getting back from the funeral home without his map. I never realized Beacon was a one-way and that I couldn't just reverse my trip. Jim, you're an angel. My room was immaculate. Ai, the housekeeper, takes such pride in her work and was always smiling as she went about preparing the rooms for the guests. The beds were so comfy that it felt just like my bed at home with the big, fluffy duvet, This is such a great location. I wish we had more time to spend...

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but showing age”
Reviews.Author: pnear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a major renovation, so I'm sure it will look fabulous once the new lobby is completed. Location is great, right beside the aquarium and close to some of the best restaurants around. I experienced excellent service here, with every staff member going out of their way to help out. Good thing too, because I was probably a bit of an annoying guest on this stay. The first room they gave me was near the elevator, which I could hear banging up and down the track every minute or so. I asked to be moved, and the only room they had available was an interior room with no windows. I stayed there, but asked to be moved the next morning to a now available exterior room. Unfortunately the heat wasn't working properly in that room, and after an discussion where the engineering staff didn't quite understand that while I had it set to 72 it was showing 64, I again asked to change rooms. My fourth and final room at the hotel was fine. Again, everyone was helpful and I was probably a challenging customer. But there's not much that even the most helpful staff can do to help with rooms that are just plain not comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “An okay experience”
Reviews.Author: susanross61
Reviews.Content: As a 20 year anniversary get-away, we booked a night at the Long Wharf and made the reservation a month ago. We told the reservation clerk it was our anniversary and we wanted a king room with a nice view (and were willing to pay more for the upgraded room). Upon check-in (around 8 pm), we were told they didn't have any more king rooms - or rooms with a view. The desk clerk was apologetic - and they did upgrade us to a "larger" room - however, it was a very ordinary handicap-accessible room with two full size beds (not even queens!). They also comp'd us the breakfast buffet in the morning. I know they don't guarantee rooms requested - but you would think they would attempt to honor a special occasion. The buffet was good (price would have been $35 for two) - and you can't beat the location. Parking at the garage next door cost us $70 for 26 hours of parking. An excellent weekend in Boston none-the-less! I would recommend the Long Wharf based on the location and a clean bed for the night. But don't set expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location; Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: tourist86
Reviews.Content: The hotel locates right by Quincy Market, Harbor, Aquarium,...really convenient for us with younger children. Room is very clean and the bed is comfortable. We booked a package with breakfast at Ocena and it's really worth it. Saw a review earlier about the unfriendly concierge and I think I may see the same lady so had similar experience. Though she provided the information, she made you feel like you were bothering her. Given other positive experience, we would love to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BRUINSLVR
Reviews.Content: Went for my honeymoon during the thanksgiving break. stayed on the 3rd floor (pool floor) kids running around at 11pm heard vacuuming also late night , for a 500$ a night in season hotel your basically paying for the location. Got A snide "thanks appreciate it" when i was unable to tip the valet so instead of paying another $44 a night to park we went across the street where we had access to our car when we wanted it. The location is phenomenal and basically within walking distance of everything but for the money i would have expected a friendlier quieter stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location . . .”
Reviews.Author: colbs714
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in or near Boston a few times before, but this was our first time at the Long Wharf. We were able to get a decent rate as a Marriott Rewards members - $195/night (although still a little hard to swallow with tax and daily parking fees but it was our five year anniversary). The location was by far one of the better places we have ever stayed in Boston. It was not even a five minute walk to Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market, and the North End was less than 10 minutes away. It was right along the water, which we probably would have taken advantage of more had the weather been nicer, but it was still a beautiful area with plenty to do. We also took advantage of one of the trolley tours which in some ways was like door to door service because the main stop is on the side of the hotel. I would definately return to the Marriott Long Wharf, and think it would be a fabulous place for the kids. Besides the aquarium, and other area attractions, there is a small park next to the hotel that has a small playscape and there is even a carousel just outside the back entrance. I cannot really comment on the service or amenities because we did not use any of the facilities or have a need to call the front desk or house keeping. The only somewhat of a downside is that the hotel does not have an area for free coffee and fruit (not a necessity, just a nice perk) although there was a Starbucks on the lower floor and there is the option to make it in your room. We were not expecting a free breakfast with our stay, so to keep the cost minimal (we splurged on lunch and dinner) we just grabbed bagels at Quincy Market in the morning. Overall, it was a very nice stay, and based on the location alone, I would definately recommend it to anyone with or without children. Our stay was pleasant, our room was clean, the beds were comfortable, there was a big screen TV in the room. In and out, our needs were met. Wish the price could have been slightly lower, but we knew that going into our stay that we could get a place with a lower price and free breakfast just outside of the mainstay. . . but then you lose the ambiance of staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: DRNH
Reviews.Content: Took a weekend getaway to the Marriott Long Wharf with my wife. The location was superb. The Blue Line T was right out the front door and the other T-Lines were within short walking distance. The hotel was across the street from Quincy Market/Fanieul Hall and on the edge of the North End. Also, the New England Aquarium is next door. The Boston Common, old State House, and Financial District are all within walking distance. We parked our car when we arrived and never moved it until we left because everything was an easy walk. There is a Starbucks in the hotel as well as a restaurant. There was some construction on the patio area of the hotel but I would imagine that during the summer it would be a nice place to sit and watch the recreational boat traffic. Check-in went smoothly and the room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The only downside was the door let a lot of hallway noise in. Other than that it was great. The only drawback we experienced was with the concierge. An older woman, we found her to be arrogant and condescending when asked about dining in the North End. When we checked in we explained that we were looking for a restaurant with a casual environment within walking distance. She said tersely, 'That's 95% of the restaurants here' I said, 'Great, what would you recommend' she replied sneeringly, 'Well, this *is* the busiest night of the week so good luck' and handed us some menus while she worked on something else. She was not friendly and certainly not helpful. We did find a nice restaurant but we did not contact the concierge for any of our other plans for the rest of the weekend. It was ironic that the worst service and attitude we received at the Marriott Long Wharf was from the Concierge.....go figure. I get friendlier service and attitudes at the Fairfield Inn with less pretense. Given the position, this is something that management should address. We'll go back but if we need any help we'll ask the bell desk. Those guys are much more down to earth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: hawker59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for touring Boston. I traveled with my teenage son to tour Boston. We had a nice stay in a clean room. Close to great dining and all of the freedom trail as well as public transportation. Initially was given an interior room, translucent window into atrium area, requested a change. They gave us another room that had a little bit of a water view. Do not expect expansive water views from this hotel as almost all of the rooms face to the sides of the wharf. Concierge was very busy as only one was on duty all of the times I went to the desk and there was always a wait. For the price I paid I would have expected a little more. Make sure that you make a reservation at Momma Maria for an incredible meal in the north end.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but...”
Reviews.Author: kevsachs
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Long Wharf in Boston is not a cheap hotel. It's ranked amongst the best Marriott hotels in the US. What you get for your money is not as expected. The hotel is very noisy (conferences, people moving in and out all the time, the wharf and port) Nevertheless it has unique features. CAN'T BEAT THAT LOCATION. Pier in front of the door. Whale Watches, Speed-boats and Dolphinarium. 5 min. to Quincy Market, 15min to Chinatown. Ducktour stop in front of the hotel door. Rooms are very clean and equipped with queen sized beds and huge LCD tv.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kricar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, you can walk everywhere or take a short cab ride. The rooms are small but very nice. The breakfast buffet offered at the hotel is excellent. Just be prepared to spend 40.00 for two people. If you are a Gold member of Marriott you get to enjoy the concierge lounge located on the top floor which offers free beverages and snacks throughout the day. As a Gold member you also dont pay the internet fee which I think is insane that a hotel in this day and age would even consider charging a room for internet access. Another fee that is unnecessary is the valet, its 44.00 per day. Compared to the pricing of other hotels in the immediate area this hotel is priced very well.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but a great location with kids”
Reviews.Author: chaquita213
Reviews.Content: In October, we spent a night at the Marriott Long Wharf in Boston. It isn't the first time we've stayed there, but both times we have had a great experience. The rooms are large (we have three young children), clean and quiet. The pool is another added bonus. We love that we can see the Harbor Seals from our rooms and that, of course, is a huge bonus for our kids. Both times we've been there it has been cold, so with just a short walk to Fanueil Hall, North End and the Aquarium, the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Boston”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend trip into the city with my family. My children (9,7,6) had a wonderful time swimming in the indoor pool and exploring the North End. We also took in the Boston Children's Museum and Faneuil Hall. Room was very nice; a bit small for the 5 of us with the cot for my son, but workable. Staff was engaging, nice and helpful Great buffet breakfast in the Oceana Restaurant; very affordable for the kids. The North End is 1/4 mile away; but the restaurants were way to crowded at 5:00 in afternoon. It was the Head of the Charles weekend. Plan ahead if you have hungry children. Columbus Park is right next door to the hotel, has a playground. My only complaints were loud hallway noise from other guests in the middle of the night, and the cost of the room was a bit high considering the room size. But, you cannot beat the location. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: AddieAid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of location, and it was just perfect. It was walking distance to the market places and Finneal Hall (SP?) and close to the subway. Little Italy (north end area) is just a 10 minute walk from here. Would def recommend this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly especially the maids. This was also exceptionally clean hotel. Perfect for a long weekend. A big plus for us was that there is a starbucks in the hotel! Although, you can find one or a dunkin donuts on every street corner

Reviews.Title: “hotel with great ammenities and great location”
Reviews.Author: dsabo
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in june for a family vacation. loved the location and the hotel . hotel was very clean and everyone was extremely friendly. the rooms were nice and clean as well as the pool area. close to great restaurants and attractions. like that it was in walking distance to littly italy.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Wharf - place to stay for business and families”
Reviews.Author: dcalianno
Reviews.Content: In June, we rented two rooms at the Boston Marriott Wharf hotel for a trip that included my 2 adult sisters, 2 teens, and my senior aged dad. This hotel is in a perfect location and the service was awesome. Since I am a member of the Marriott Rewards program, we had access to the concierge floor which provided complimentary breakfast, late afternoon and late evening snacks. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the views were incredible. The hotel is right by the Aquarium, boat tour docks, QUincy Market, Fenuiel Hall, and a short walk to Little Italy. There is also a subway station right outside the hotel which also made travel in the city easy. I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Destinhousewife
Reviews.Content: Using Marriott points, I had a hard time deciding whether to stay at the Marriott Copley, Tremont or the Long-Wharf. We chose the Long Wharf property and was soooo pleased we did! We had a beautiful room with two double beds & granite bathroom, and a view of the city on the seventh floor. The tram is the easiest and least expensive way to see Boston ($15 for the week!), AND it is located directly out of the door of the hotel. If you have status at the Marriott, you will love the Concierge Lounge which overlooks the harbor on the 7th floor. Delicious breakfast & happy hour horderves. I highly recommend doing the Freedom Trail "Run" (freedomtrailrun.com), that was the highlight of our trip! After the running tour, you take a ferry back which lets off directly at the hotel harbor! I also suggest dining in the Italian District â€“ there so many fabulous restaurants to choose from. My favorite place was Nicoâ€™s, small & elegant, and fun! Taxi to Italian District is $6. You can print your boarding passes right in the lobby for your return trip home. Highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again next time in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Best by far”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer39
Reviews.Content: Must admit that I selected this hotel by default. Had no idea just how convenient and spectacular this hotel is. Friendly service, very clean, quiet rooms and terrific location. Steps from the north end, T station right out the door, major water events within a 9 iron and awesome views, this is a magnificent hotel for visitng Boston. We were with our grandson and everything was perfection. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: dylamon98
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to tour the city and stayed here. Overall, this is a nice hotel with a great location. Very close to Quincy Market, NE Aquarium, the waterfront and the Italian section of Boston. Rooms were clean and the pool and gym are excellent. Only complaints are relatively minor...we expect that for the price you would get queen beds instead of twins. Also, service by the bartenders in the restaurant and one of the bellhops did not meet my expectations for a hotel of this calibre. Otherwise, would definitely stay there again due to location and cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: ttenil
Reviews.Content: stayed recently at the Boston Marriott Long Wharf with my teenage children and husband. Loved the location, you can not beat it. Right out of your doorsteps was the harbor for boat rides, whale watching boat rides, ferry to Providence RI. Also right there is the Aquarium. Literally across the street is Quincy market, which we had a couple of dinners there and lunch in the very large food court with all kinds of fun foods!.. The Rooms in the hotel were clean and comfortable. My only problem is I felt that the entranceway and lobby in the hotel was not clean. The windows( and there are many) always had many fingerprints all over and was never cleaned. The lobby also seemed in need of a refurbishment. This would not happen in a more expensive hotel. Not that this hotel is cheap but you are paying for the location. Location, Location, Location!!! We would go back to this hotel because of the fabulous location. Great for younger or older kids! My children were 16 and 17 and they loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located and Worth Every (EXTRA) Penny”
Reviews.Author: SarahCNewYork
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews say--this is a great location. Walk out the door and you are a 2 minute walk to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, The Aquarium, street vendors, great sidewalk restaurants and a lovely view of the harbor. There is a small park outside the hotel that featured some local bands playing, and people sat and picnicked--it was such a nice atmosphere. Yes, for a 2 night stay in a harbor view room, we paid about $1000 all told for the room and taxes and parking , but this is a nice hotel set on the harbor in the middle of everything in Boston--they can charge whatever they want, and those rooms will get booked just for the sheer convenience and beauty of its location. So just enjoy your stay in this hotel, and know that it IS overpriced. The staff was very nice--it was our anniversary and they sent little snacks to our room both nights of our stay. Very thoughtful of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: chips57
Reviews.Content: We would stay at the Marriott Long Wharf again but the one downfall is parking is very expensive if you drive there at $44.00 a night....There is a Starbucks in the hotel, the people were friendly and helpful, the restaurant in the hotel was good. Just outside is a Legal Sea Foods restaurant and also right nearby is the New England Aquariium plus the wharf is right there for Harbor Cruises, whale watching,etc. You can also take a trolley tour starting right at the hotel. Everything is in walking distance...great restaurants in the North End or Italian district. The hotel was a bit pricey but worth it for al it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT BOSTON HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: marygrozier
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Boston Long Wharf Marriott when in Boston. It's right in the heart of everything. You can get all the local tours practically right in front of the hotel. You also can take many boat tours at the Long Wharf Pier. If you want to take a trip to Cape Cod, just jump on the Provincetown Ferry and you're there in 90 minutes. This hotel is just beautiful. The service is perfect, the decor lovely, restaurants fabulous and the surrounding area cannot be beat. You can't go wrong with this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirhobbes
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for your Boston visit. It's right by the wharf, so all the whale watching and harbor cruises are right there. It's across the street from Faneul Hall and a very short walk to Little Italy and sites like the Old North Church. You can take the water taxi from Logan airport right to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location, Location....Tourists,Tourists,Tourists”
Reviews.Author: journeymeister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Long Wharf Marriott for a long summer weekend getaway. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the rooms were clean, and the hotel location was perfect, as it was literally in the middle of everything for a Boston sightseeing trip. Be prepared, however, to be in the midst of other travellers with the same idea, as well as all the tots and teens that come with family excusions. Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall are across the street,offering good food at a reasonable fare. Several Irish Pubs are a short stroll down State Street. The Freedom Trail, Public Gardens, and access to the "T" for cheap, efficient transportation are also nearby, as well as Water Tours and cruises available right outside the hotel. Overall, we had a great weekend without the need to rent a car, at a good hotel in the middle of it all. For better or worse, just be aware of the like-minded crowds that will be a part of the scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after flying in to BOS and then were traveling up the coast. the location is perfect - right on the harbor. It is a short cab ride from the airport. Easy walk over to downtown Boston and sightseeing. The rooms are done in the new Marriott design. Beds were very comfortable. We originally had a room on the second floor overlooking the harbor and the entrance, but my husband felt it was too noisy and had them move us to a room on the city side - quiet, but no view. There are plenty of places to go eat & drink nearby and the bar has a patio. There is a small pool. The only negative is that parking costs $44 - but you are in the middle of the city. Hotel IS pricy, but it's a great location and a comfortable room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Harborside Views and Everything in Boston Close By”
Reviews.Author: BucketLists
Reviews.Content: Everone and everything was top notch. Wonderful beds and bedding - even though the room was a little small - the creature comforts were there. DO try the breakfast buffett ~ Excellent. Do use the indoor pool, jaccuzzi, work out rooms - very well kept. If you are a Marriott member - be sure and visit the Conceirge level for oustanding service and views of the harbor from the 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, too expensive, average customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Simplythinking
Reviews.Content: I had hoped for much more from a Marriott property. The room was clean, and the bed very comfortable. The location was central to many Boston attractions, but the noise levels outside during the late evening and early morning hours certainly made you wish you made a different choice in location. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but very pricey. Internet access was an additional charge - in a time when wifi is free in so many places, parking -out of site - all this when you are paying top dollar for the room. Also note, you can not rely on hours posted for the Starbucks coffee stand as I went to get a drink 45 minutes prior to close and was told in an unpleasent voice by their staff "We are closed".

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: glenareel
Reviews.Content: View is beautiful. We were able to watch the USS Constitution annual turnaround from the pool area. Nice views of Boston Harbor. Conveniently located near Aquarium and other kid-friendly activities. T-station outside the front door. The rooms are small and a little more than the hotels away from waterfront, but the benefits outweigh these negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a leisure stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: gearini
Reviews.Content: Long Wharf overlooks Boston Harbor next to the aquarium. It is close to all of the main Boston attractions. Rooms are spacious and clean, however the towels in our room were past their shelf life - at home, we would use them to clean the car! Long Wharf has reasonable bar / restaurant, although it is quite expensive compared with the local hotels. However, the patio has a great view of the harbour, so is a good place to have a quiet beer. We got a good rate (c $250 per night), but when we looked again at the marriott website a few days before we visited, it had risen to over $400 per night - not sure if we were lucky or they were runnig a speical when we booked back in April.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the attractions we wanted to visit: aquarium, IMAX theater, Quincy Market, etc. We were steps away from the wharf where the cruises launched and the trolley bus tour also departed from the corner in front of the hotel. We stayed for two nights and the room was OK - we had requested two double beds, but were given a King room with a cot. The space was pretty tight with the cot in the room and the bathroom was on the small side. The room was very clean and the beds (and cot) were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for many reasons.......”
Reviews.Author: lisa22Boston
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to do a variety of activities in the city with 3 14yr. old boys. Location was perfect......Aquarium, IMAX, Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall, North End, Legal Sea Food, Harbor, etc. So much to do within the neighborhood. Room was like new. Ask to be near the elevator if you need to. Breakfast Brunch in hotel restaurant was excellent even for any picky eater or one with high standards. Starbucks in lobby, park for kids outside. Only surprise was the size of the pool. It is pretty small although the picture on the website makes it look very big. We didn't park at the hotel and the fee is ridiculous but it seems all hotels are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marlilyn44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly for first time visitors to Boston. Location is key. You are on the waterfront, beside the Aquarium, the best place to eat - Legal Seafood is just across the street, the trolly car stop is just outside of the hotel, and its the starting point of the trolly tour, This is a must do, for $38.00 for a two day trolly pass you can get on and off the trolly to see the city. You got to stop at the second stop - the USS Constitution, and museum - free tour of the ship, its facinating! then you can walk the freedom trail to Bunker Hill, which is very nice, then hop back on the trolly and go to the next stop. Quincy Market is located steps away from the hotel so that is convenient. You can walk over to the Barking Crab for a lobster dinner. Overall, the location is the best thing about this hotel. Hotel is clean, pool is very small, the beds are not so comfortable neither the pillows. The bathrooms have bath & body works aromatherapy soaps and lotions - very nice. I forgot my jacket in the hotel room, and they were kind enough to fed ex it to me at no charge and I live in Canada. Now that's service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: muellerdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and the original room we were given smelled like wet towels. It was bad enough we asked for another room. We were immediately moved to another room. We walked to the North End for dinner and came back and enjoyed a cocktail on the outside terrace overlooking the harbor. Excellent views! Wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in the Middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: kristen028
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Long Wharf is a very nice hotel. The hotel is located right along the Boston Harbor. It has a beautiful view. It is right in the middle of everything; a great seafood restaurant, Legal Seafood, the aquarium, sightseeing tours ( trollies, whale watching, etc.), Fanueil Hall and Market Place ( great shops and restaurants), and the History Trail. The room was very nice. Bathroom was a little small, but not a problem at all. Bed's were comfortable. I have read some reviews where people say the rooms were small or tiny..not at all, completely normal size hotel rooms. Also read in reviews that the heating/ac unit in the rooms were loud- we didn't hear it at all. Only thing to look out for, mini-frig in room in not a frig., its a cooler, and it doesn't keep things too cold. Wonderful stay. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ufd145
Reviews.Content: Service and staff were great and frendly from the moment we pulled up to valet. Location is perfect - just steps to Harbour Cruise, OLD TOWN TROLLEY, Quincey Market, PUBS, Restaurants. Love the fact that the pool/health club opens at 6 am - took advantage of the peace and watching the sun rise over the Bay. Dinner was great in the Oceana where they also do a great breakfast buffet. The staff made us feel that our satisfaction was important.

Reviews.Title: “the location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: robin132
Reviews.Content: my husband and I have been staying in this hotel for years. we love it for the location, friendly staff and great restaurants nearby. everyone is very accommodating to your needs. there is also paid parking on site, very convenient. my only wish would be that it be a little less expensive so we could visit more often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bostona
Reviews.Content: Location is unbeatable, right next door to the acquarium, steps from Quincy Market, a 15' walk from Boston Common, A bit noisy if you get a low floor, with rooms that are alligned on the corridor that faces an open space, but on thre 6th and 7th floor are very quiet. Staff is friendly and helpful. I've stayed at this hotel many times and will go back again. It has all you would expect from a Marriott. North End with great italian restaurants is steps away as well. And if you plan to go to a Celtics or Bruins game, TD Garden is within walking distance. If you are coming from the airport, the hotel is just two stops on the Blue Line (Acquarium stop), literally steps away from the hotel's front door. If you don't have too much luggage, beats the 25-30$ cab ride. Just grab the airport shuttle that will take you to the T stop.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE NOISE NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: FirstLight
Reviews.Content: We specifically asked for a quiet room, never having stayed there, and the room we were given was down the hall from a pool that they keep open until 11, and a video game arcade that never seemed to close! This drew every unescorted kid in the place to our hall, screaming thumping and chasing around, and to make things worse this place has a central 6 floor high atrium ceiling, aka echo chamber from hell. Unfortunately we didn't know all this until that night, by then too late to move to another hotel. The rooms are dinky, the double bedded ones have one chair laughably squeezed by the window, and a nasty split bathroom door that will cause you harm during a night time bathroom run. Oh, and the little compartment labelled "refrigerator"? It's only a cooler, so if you store leftovers in there you're in for a very upset stomach the next day. And watch out walking out the main entrance, the valets whip cars backwards onto the side walk without looking back, and you'd better hop to to avoid being hit. Too bad, the location is great, but it's like trying to stay in the middle of a grade school playground, only louder and more rude (the kids crowd around the elevators on floor 3 and never board, so good luck!).

Reviews.Title: “Overall - A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy_2B_Her3
Reviews.Content: The heating/cooling system didn't have a fan that you could turn on manually. We're used to the white noise at home, and it would have masked the noise of other guests going in and out of their rooms while we were trying to sleep. Neither my husband nor I got a very good night's sleep because of that. We didn't appreciate the $6/beer charge at the concierge lounge, especially in light of the fact that we had paid $50 extra for its use. (I understand charging for the beverages, but charging exorbitant prices was off-putting.) Although, the appetizers and dessert they put out at night were very good, and the continental breakfast was fine. Every person I encountered who worked there, except for the person who checked us in, went WAY out of their way to be helpful, without being annoying, which I really appreciated. The service is above board. Our room had a beautiful view, overlooking the aquarium and the harbor, which was our reason for visiting Boston. My three year old son loved the swimming pool, and the health club looked like it had A LOT of equipment. I appreciated the fact that the hotel put out fruit in various places for guests. I also really liked having a Starbuck's in the hotel, and Legal Seafood across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jeff75kim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night and had a great time. The location is directly acroos the street from the New England Aquariium and Quincy Market (shopping). The parking is expensive, $44 for 24 hours, but all of the other parking garages and lots are just as high (plus they valet your car). The front desk staff was very professional and cordially welcomed us for our stay. We were fortunate to be able to get a room on the Concierge Level (seventh floor) which had a great view of Columbus Park. The blue lights at night in the park were fabulous. The Concierge Level had a reception which served appetizers and drinks (had to pay for the drinks though). The front desk ordered a 1/2 bottle of wine with cheese and crackers as soon as we arrived, which promptly arrived within five minutes of getting in the room. My wife and I walked across Atlantic Avenue to Quincy Market and ate dinner followed by some shopping. The bed in the room was really comfortable. Turn-down service left chocolates on the bedside table and truned down the bed while we were away for dinner, nice touch. When we got up in the morning we noticed the Concierge Lounge on the seventh floor was serving a continental breakfast, which had a great variety to choose from. The view from the Concierge Lounge was absolutely spectacular and the staff was very friendly. After breakfast we made our way out to see some sights and were promptly greeted in front of the hotel by multiple Trolley Tours of the city. We paid $44, $22 apiece, to get a trolley tour of all of the major historical sites in the city. The driver of the tour was very amusing and you are able to exit the trolley at any of the designated stops and hop on the next trolley passing by, it allowed you to view the sights at your leisure. Overall, we had a great stay in Boston and would definetly go back and stay at this hotel again. Very convenient location and not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Made our family trip great!”
Reviews.Author: rmarma68
Reviews.Content: Great location for our overnight in Boston to go to the NE Aquarium. Was traveling with 7 and 5 year-olds, and a two month old. Was able to park there (valet, bit pricey at $44 per night) when we arrived at 10:30 even though check-in was not until 4:00. We planned to store our luggage and walk to the aquarium but they gave us an available room - 5 hours prior to check-in! Made it so much easier to enjoy the day. Kids also loved the indoor pool (of course, the favorite part of their trip) which are hard to find in downtown Boston hotels. Room was comfortable and served us well for the one night. Seems to have been recently remodeled. Large TV and comfortable beds. Navigating the bathroom door (two narrow doors, one with inside handle) was a bit weird but not too big a problem. Pillows were too soft and could have used more. Read reviews with the noise in the heating system - agree it was constant, but pretty consistent with every hotal stay I have experienced. Navigating the hotel was a bit challenging with the kids and a baby stroller. Have to take an escalator to enter/exit the hotel or an elevator. And then a separate elevator across a large atrium to get to the floors. But location was great! Was able to walk to aquarium in three minutes, walked to Legal Seafood (concierge made last minute reservations), walked to 7-11 when lost the baby's pacifier. T stop and Trolley Tour stop right there, less than a minute walk. Sorry did not take advantage of the trolley. Also buffet in the morning was excellent - good selection of foods at appropriate temperatures with attentive service of staff. Will be going here again - kids already can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: getrandom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf several times while in Boston for both business and pleasure. Overall, it is standard Marriott fare in the lobby, lounge, and restaurant. Everything is adequate and the beds are great. However, the hotel does also offer a great view from most rooms and an excellent location for visiting the historic and business areas of downtown Boston. Overall, I recommend this hotel and have chosen it myself for most visits to this fine city.

Reviews.Title: “hummmmmmmmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: ohmark
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in many ways and with a great location, but all for naught because it is difficult (or in my case, impossible) to get a quiet room. As mentioned by other reviewers, there is a constant low hum/rumble, apparently from the hotel's heating system, that will make sleep difficult for many (including your's truly). Changed room three times during my five nights, but to no avail. Noise was at different levels in the three rooms: from very loud to extremely loud to just plain loud. I finally gave up trying to find a reasonably quiet room and just slept with pillows over my ears. However, if your hearing is not good or you don't hear low pitched noise, then the hotel's location makes it attractive for tourists. The concierge lounge has beautiful views although the offerings are not particularly generous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tipsy252
Reviews.Content: Arriving just before Christmas on a very cold, dark winter evening, we were immediately made to feel welcome. The room was comfortable and very quiet. Breakfast the following day was good value and set us up for the day, the staff were all very friendly. The concierge, Julie was very helpful, she helped us with restaurant bookings and provided directions for us. Really enjoyed the swimming pool although it was a bit cold after getting out, probably due to the extremely low temps outside. The hotel is close to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market and the North End and from here it is easy to pick up the Freedom Trail. TIP: Just around the corner is the Old Town Trolley tour office - do this ride, it is a great way to enjoy the city and to orient yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough -- but what is that noise?”
Reviews.Author: WDF2
Reviews.Content: I'm writing from the hotel, on the second of night of a two day stay. The other reviews capture the pluses and minuses pretty well: Great location; too expensive; rooms clean and in good shape; design somewhat dated. But what is this low rumbling noise that comes from the heating vents? It sounds something like a condenser on a large refrigerator. (The heat is off by the way.) The noise woke me up at 3am. Ear plugs don't help much. I asked for a different room this morning and was very kindly accommodated. Now I'm on the opposite side of the building (still the 6th floor), but the noise is essentially the same. Too bad TripAdvisor doesn't allow us to post audio files.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Experience of my life...”
Reviews.Author: jbigs79
Reviews.Content: First off - I never write reviews, good or bad, so this is the real deal... I stayed here and had multiple terrible experiences. I travel and stay at hotels over 100 times a year and this was easly my worse stay. Parking staff were great. However, the hotel manager (a women) and restauratnt manager/staff were rude, made assumptions about guests, and treated us like 3rd world citizens. If I ever have a choice, I would not stay at this hotel again. Honestly, I would pay more to stay at a less hotel not to be treated like the staff made me feel here. Simply described, my hotel experience here was the worse of my lifetime and I will not stay here again - I do not make assumptions about guests and I rathe be treated with respect, therefore I will not stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle...and you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: PhillyRose420
Reviews.Content: Generally I like the hotel. Its consistantly higher than similar hotels as it is right next to the aquarium and across the the street from Quincy Market. If its warm you can walk all over Boston. I'd recommend cheaper places but there are no real issues except the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and lonely pre-Christmas weekend”
Reviews.Author: BayStateBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Decent amenities, but not a warm or romantic place two weeks before before Christmas. Lack of holiday decor, lack of ambiance - and a cold draft everywhere in the hotel, from the 3rd-floor guest room to the bar to the only restaurant. According to the desk clerk, the hotel was less than a third full for the weekend, and yet there were no water view rooms available without paying a significant "upgrade" fee. The staff was as helpful as one would expect from a decent hotel, but did not in any way go out of their way to be helpful. No concierge on duty - again, this was two weekends before Christmas. No recommendations for shopping, restaurants, a night on the town, etc. The value would have been very similar at the Courtyard, for much less money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean and well located...”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynmc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were just in Boston for one night only and chose to stay at the Marriott Long Wharf. I had stayed there as a kid over 20 years ago and had fond memories. The hotel is looking a little tired and the architecture inside and out looks dated, but it is clean, priced well and perfectly located for our needs. Oddly enough, this hotel must be one of the few hotels in the world that is directly on the water but has no water views from the rooms... STUPID! Valet parking was $44 for the night which seems like a rip off even to a New Yorker. You can find cheaper parking nearby but not much cheaper. The staff was super friendly and professional, constantly hugging and welcoming back regular guests by name. I am sure you could find quieter hotels as well as this is cheaper, close to TD Garden and appeared to be having some kind of young person function like maybe a gymnastics event or something as there were many young high school or college aged women arounds. Within steps of the hotel are many entertainment options from my favorite, the Boston Aquarium to the duck boats, Quincy Market, TD Banknorth Garden and within a short cab ride of Beacon Hill, Newbury Street, the Boston Common and the museums. Boston is a relatively compact city that is fairly easy to get around. Cabs are harder to find than in my hometown of NYC so I recommend standing in front of a hotel to get one. The room we were in, room 662, was a corner room, fairly quiet and had an angled view of just a touch of the harbor. The layout is strange and the double doors on the bathroom awkward for privacy, but overall clean and comfortable. The bathroom was more than acceptable and the bed quite comfortable. The flat, wall mounted TV was of good quality. There was a nice iPod doc and the bedside lamps were even kind of nice with the option to dime them. We opted for the breakfast deal, included in the price of the room, and it was worth the money. Waffle and omlet bar, fresh fruit and juices, cereals and muffins, bacon and sausage, coffee and tea, etc. The restaurant itself looked recently renovated and was actually nicely decorated with a tasteful nautical theme. If money is not tight, you have many better, pricier hotels to choose from. If value is important, the Marriott Long Wharf is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: ZRHGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf for four nights because my husband had business in Boston. Although his convention was at the Westin, we wanted something close to the waterfront and the markets. While the hotel location is fabulous, the hotel itself is a bit "tired" looking and is in desperate need of updating. The carpets, the painting, the decorations, all look like they've been around for awhile and the hotel would dramatically improve with a more contemporary style. As it is now, I would opt for a hotel with more style.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ddmcd
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Marriott Long Warf over a long weekend. The location is fantastic, especially since this was our first time in the city. So much within walking distance and the T right outside the front door. Our room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping did a nice job cleaning the room everyday. There is an electric â€œcoolerâ€� in the room. I didnâ€™t think it was working because I thought it was a fridge. When I called the front desk they said it was a cooler and would only keep things cool, not chill things down. But, if I wanted a fridge they would provide one free of charge. Sure enough it was set-up and running when we got back from sightseeing. It was also very quiet in the room, couldn't hear the neighbors at all. The view from the pool is really magnificent- panoramic view of the harbor. You can watch the sailboats and sightseeing boats go by- they dock right outside. Friday and Saturday the farmers market is right across the street â€“ great fun and really nice produce. For breakfast everyday we ate fruit from the farmers market and pastry from the north end bakeries (a 5 minute walk) stored neatly in our fridge. The Hotel staff was especially accommodating with any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, Exceptional service, Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeafriendlyPhoto
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Long Wharf Marriott every year on our passage to Maine to visit with family. We have two young ones under 5, so leisure travel is not typically taken "so leisurely". However, with the aid of the exceptionally helpful staff at the Long Wharf Marriott our stays are always successful and pleasant memories. Last year we were due to fly out during the largest storm of the year. I phoned ahead and asked the desk clerk if we could check into our room early. She understood that we had little ones with us and might need some extra help. After a short hold, she promised an upgraded room with early check-in approx. 6 hours before normal check-in time. Upon arrival our car was quickly ushered into covered parking and our little one's noses never had to touch the blizzard's frozen bite. Our 5th level room had a fantastic view of the harbor & some city life overlooking a small park - which beautifully lights up at night giving off a mixture of blue saphire color. The location is perfect for runs to the nearby famous Quincy Market for any type of food (a range which spans the globe) - our favorite is the Sri-Lankan. We made the most of our time by visiting the Boston Aquarium which is also just next door. Our experience with our last visit was exceptional, our experiences in the past 3 years of visiting are no less fantastic. We plan to continue our stays with each year, and hope you and yours experience the same greatness we have..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: rsc4etc
