The hotel also had a Starbucks just inside the doors and it always had a line. The hotel is in a beautiful area, very safe, attractive and on the docks with boats anchored in the harbor. Adjacent to the hotel is the grassy Christopher Columbus park. There are numerous good restaurants all within walking distance (like just across the street) including Legal Sea Food (the best crab cakes we had), Joe's (just across the park) which had great hamburgers and French Onion Soup). Joe's was always busy and it looked like many locals ate there. Also just behind the hotel was the Chart House (steak/seafood) and attached to the building was a very [popular (and noisy) Tia's which drew a young crowd at the outdoor patio every night. This hotel as are all the downtown hotels is expensive. I searched all the web hotel services like expedia, priceline etc and I still got a slightly lower price on the Marriott web site. A Saturday stay can lower your costs. We paid $254/night for three. Afterwards I checked the prices and they were as high as $399! Way too much at that price unless for the top floor concierge rooms. Our room was a medium sized King room as none of the two double bed rooms were available. Though they brought in a pretty decent single rollaway for our third guest a child. The room could hardly take the bed and the staff had to move furniture around to get the rollaway bed in. The room was clean and attractive and had a very comfortable bed was extremely well insulated for sound and the drapes kept the room pitch black (one morning we slept-in until 10:30 because we forgot to set the alarm). The hotel also has a free business center (very small) with Internet access and printers as well as free wifi in the business center but not throughout the hotel. See attached pictures of hotel and immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but crowded.”
Reviews.Author: Adams
Reviews.Content: We live outside of Boston and have stayed at many of the hotels in the area. This hotel is good if you want to stay in the heart of the tourist area. You are next to the Aqarium, walking distance from the North End and Fleet Center ( New Garden) and across from Fanuial Hall. There is a great rooftop deck on the third floor, as well as a great gym and indoor pool. Request a room on that floor if these appeal to you. Most of the rooms do not overlook the water but as soon as you walk out you are at the harbor, by the boats and near a park. This place is best in the summer months. We found the rooms- just okay but the bed was comfortable and you could not hear the outside noise. The biggest detractor for us was the tour busses and heards of tourists as soon as you left the hotel. There is a Legal Seafood across the street and great Italian restaurnats just a few blocks away( try Mikes Pastry). The parking is cheaper at the Boston Harbor Garage on Milk St by the aquarium than at the hotel. If we stayed in that area again we would choose the Millenium- it was the same price, had a terrace and we liked the rooms better. The Marriott Long Wharf is good for kids or people who don't like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - absolutely awful - avoid at any price!!”
Reviews.Author: dagGothenburg_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Boston Marriott Long Wharf with my family. From the moment we checked in until we left it was simply an awful experience. Just like staying in a cheap youth hostel. We had to queue half an hour to check in. Only one person in the reception and she was absolutely awful! No luggage arrived in our rooms. After 2 hours we had to make several calls to locate our bags which were nearly lost! The rooms were dirty, smelly and no extra bed available for our 7 year old daugher. The hotel is in a poor location. Hard to walk to central Boston. The rate we paid was similar to rates charged by Taj Boston, Ritz Carlton and other hotels. I will always regret having chosen this terrible terrible place. I am a Platinum Elite member and stay 70-80 nights a year with Marriott and this was by far the worst Marriott stay I have ever had. Will not even talk about the terrible breakfast experiences we had....... AVOID IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our worst stay at the Marriot”
Reviews.Author: GK0
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 3 nights stay at the Marriott Long Wharf in Boston. Whatever can go wrong went wrong with our stay. 1. Marriott made mistake with our reservation so we were placed in their small standard room with 2 double beds for $299.00. We were party of 2 adults and 2 teenage daughters. We were told by CARMEN at the front desk that they didn't have the corner unit that I requested. She said that our reservation didn't request the corner unit so that when the corner unit next to us opened up, we couldn't get it. She had to give it to someone who REQUESTED it. Finally around 9:30, we decided that this wasn't going to work so that we called in to shorten our stay. ROCHELLE from the the front desk immediately searched for bigger room for us and found the corner unit which we were told were fully booked. She apologized for the misunderstanding since our reservation shows my request for the bigger room. 2. Our third and final night, room next door left their joining door open and decided to have a LOUD LOUD sex session at 10:00 pm. We were all watching TV. My husband tried to match the volume with TV but they were louder. Thank God the session were interrupted by a phone call from their friend. After 3 calls to the front desk went without any action, I went down to ask if anything can be done about this. ANDREW placed me and my daughters in another room for no charge. This room was located right above the street level bar which were filled with at least 50 young patrons. They all left by 2:00 am. My daughters slept with pillows over their head. At least this noise was preferred to the other noise. Beside our events, we were extremely happy with the service from rest of the staff. This will not deter me from other Marriott hotel/resort since I have stayed in so many without any incidents but I will ask more questions and double check with my future hotel bookings.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LoverofBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf for 7 nights. What a perfect location. It was close to every attraction. A couple of times we took a taxi up to the Prudential Center and walked back to the hotel after siteseeing. The taxis are just sitting there waiting for you. To get to the Prudential Center it was $15.00 including tip. We could have taken the "T" which was right in front of the hotel but chose the taxi. We had two adults and two teenagers. If you call the hotel 3 days before you arrive you can "request" a corner room which is much larger than the average room. We had a huge picture window, 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa. The room was their wheelchair accessable room which made it roomier. It was worth it! Besides being within walking distance of the North End, Beacon Hill, Freedom Trail, Fanuail Hall, Quincy Market, Filene's Basement, it had an unbelievable view of the Harbor on their sun deck outside their pool. It was a wonderful place to relax after site seeing all day. They also have a gym, a game room with pinball machines and a laundry room. We ended up eating in the lounge of the Oceana Restaurant. The prices were a little better than the dining room and the food was great. Overall the hotel was a little more expensive than some hotels but the location, convenience and ammenities made it all worthwhile. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market”
Reviews.Author: American500
Reviews.Content: Upon arrivial at Logan, I took the water taxi to Long Wharf. I would not recommend this type of travel to/from the hotel. You have to wait for a bus to then take you to the water taxi pier. Not too fun when toting luggage. The hotel is geared for the businessman, not the average tourist. Rooms are nice Marriott quality. The restaurants and room service have great food and selection. The prices seemed very high to me, perhaps this is normal for a prime Boston address. I liked the location the best which is only a 5-minute walk to Quincy Market. The Marriott Custom House is nearby and looked really, really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Not recommended for peace/quiet”
Reviews.Author: dogloverinct
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Longwharf for a long weekend. Great location. T stop literally right outside front door, Aquarium steps away, Harbor taxi also right outside front door, and Fanuiel Hall/Quincy Marketplace right across the street. The North End is a short walk away (2 - 3 blocks), which is Boston's Little Italy. Great restaurants there. Word of advice - most of those restaurants are booked solid for dinner on the weekends. Make reservations weeks in advance. Check the internet for Italian restaurants in the North End - they are all generally within one street of each other. Honestly, I don't think you can go wrong with any of the restaurants there. We particularly liked Florentine Cafe for casual lunch. When we were there (mid-May 2007) there was some kind of function on the first floor. The first room we were given was on the first floor and overlooked the function (some of the hotel's rooms are set up in an atrium style overlooking the floors below.) We asked for a move to another room that would be quieter and were given a room on the 6th floor, which is not set up in an atrium style. Unfortunately, the noise from the hallway is very loud, and if the room is close to the elevator, people tend to forget how voices carry in the hallways. Overall, the hotel was OK but the noise was difficult to deal with. I travel quite a bit for work and find that I am sensitive to noise in the hallway, but this particular hotel seemed louder than most. Loud late at night and loud early in the morning. Large amount of children in the hotel, assume because of proximity to Aquarium. Bring a white noise machine or ear plugs. Bottom line is the hotel is kind of dated, but seemed clean and service was good. Can't beat location. Not great for romantic get-away due to noise and kid factor. Concierge floor might have been better but is $100 per night more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.............Will Not Go Again. Thumbs Down!”
Reviews.Author: fabfinds
Reviews.Content: I will be the first to tell you I am a picky traveler, I am discerning and am lucky to be able to afford staying at generally the best hotels wherever we go. We travel often and especially to Boston where my kids go to college so when we go the hotel of choice for us is hands down HOTEL COMMONWEALTH, an exquisite little gem of a boutique hotel which is spotless, beautifully and tastefully decorated, with the best in the bedding, best toiletries,etc............this time they were sold out for the Red Sox game so we had to look at another hotel. I figured Marriott would be fine, we have stayed at several particularly the JW Marriotts as that is their high end brand and we have always been happy with them. This hotel has a great location, near the boats, wharf, harbor,etc.........however the hotel itself is a rather ugly 80's looking outdated building. Cold feeling when you step inside and not at all a luxury kind of hotel. The hallways feel almost like a glorified holiday inn or radison. We get in the room and its very small, they have just put in new bedding which looked very cozy but the other elements in the room were very mediocre. The bathroom was dated and very average, again very small. We go out for a wonderful treat of a dinner to the Chart House, an old Boston favorite with wonderful ambiance and great food. We come back, I pull back the covers and see hair on my mattress, I ALWAYS inspect my mattress/sheets. I then notice in other random areas, like 5 other pieces of hair! GROSS!! My son proceeds to pull his sheets back and starts laughing and tells me his bed too has hair all over it! Sure enough he is right and I am so grossed out at this point, I make a frantic call to the manager, at this point there is only a front desk manager who promptly comes to the room, very apologetic and embarrassed. She then takes our things and we go to another room for "inspection," shockingly this room has stained sheets! I am so grossed out at this point I seriously contemplate sleeping in my car!! So...............finally we see a third room which seems to have clean sheets. At this point I am wiped out, going through the halls in my pjs and robe like a vagabond was ridiculous! The hair is downright inexcusable, the one with the stain should never have been resused, it looked clean but with an old stain but thats disgusting! I barely slept I just felt like everything was dirty and I feared for what I didn't see! On top of all this, the concierge left something to be desired, when I checked in he assured me we were only 3 blocks from a place we had to be early the next morning only to find out we were nearly 20 minutes away! Then he gave us the wrong directions to another place we had to go to right outside of Boston and had us traveling nearly 25 minutes in the wrong direction until we finally stopped at a gas station only to find this out! The next morning we went to I believe its called Oceana, for breakfast, pretty place but just didn't give me a clean and pristine feel. I was VERY anxious to get out of that room though. Breakfast was OK, the waiter was sloppy and there were no saucers served with my coffee so there were coffee stains all over the tablecloth, the carafe was dripping, he brought me small jars of jam and one had been opened and used. YUCK! Basically I sensed a lack of quality control here, just really turned off to the hotel period. The hotel just doesn't feel polished with regard to decor and service, it does not hold a candle or come even remotely close to Commonwealth. This is NOT an upscale place at all, possibly a good convention hotel for a non discerning traveler. I did speak to a general manager and in his defense, he offered what Marriott is famous for, great customer service and followup. He promptly issued a full refund, which he said should have been done the night before and was very apologetic but genuinely thankful for my calling him. I will continue to believe in Marriott, because I have stayed in some excellent hotels but unfortunately this did not live up to their name and just disappointed in every way. This hotel needs a major refurbishing in my opinion. For what we paid, nearly 400.00 for a very small and very average room, I don't feel it was worth it even if the "hair on the sheets" incident didn't apply. Seems like some really like this hotel, which I find interesting...........as I said from the start I prefaced this review by admitting I am a picky and discerning traveler, but believe me anyone would have been VERY turned off by what happened to me. I am sorry to report this but feel its worth sharing.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: joy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from April 5 -9, 2007. I had stayed here several years ago on a business meeting and liked the location. However, this visit was over the Easter weekend so many families were staying in the hotel. As an Elite Gold member, I had requested an upgrade to the concierge floor but did not receive it, but was given key access to the lounge. Having lounge access is a great benefit at this hotel because it is open 7 days a week, unlike other Marriotts in the US. The benefit is a free breakfast and evening desserts The concierge lounge staff does a great job keeping up with the crowds that I experienced on the weekend with constant replinishing of food and cleaning of tables. One downside was that there were many unruly children who were unsupervised, particularly during the evening. Some were "skating" on skateshoes across the marble floor and others would poking their fingers in the lovely desserts offered in the lounge. No lounge staff attempted to address the situation. You would thing that there would be some rule about unattended children. The rooms were small but nicely furnished with comfortable beds. However, the noise factor through the walls in adjacent rooms and children running up and down the hallways was unbearable. Additionally, upon checkout I noticed I had a restaurant charge of $60 and had never eaten in the hotel restaurant. The front desk clerk, rather than removing immediately as has always been my experience in such charges, made me wait about 1 hour while she "looked into the situation." This is no way to treat a Marriott loyalist. She finally confirmed it was an incorrect charge.. Overall, this is a great hotel if you have children with you as they will "blend" in with the others. Being close to the Aquarium is probably the draw. However, I would not stay here again when I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dakinetraveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Boston due to the convenience of the Marriot Longwharf.. We stayed during the Thanksgiving holiday and found the hotel perfectly located close to everything, hotel staff was very efficient and we were allowed to check in before 7:00 a.m. just coming off a red-eye flight was a blessing.. Concierge service was great, Dave, ordered a rent-a-car for us and it was delivered right on time to the front door and upon return the valet service held the car until the company was able to retrieve it..As per previous reports, the subway was literally right outside the front door in which anywhere you wanted to visit was easy to access..Maybe the reason we were so happy with the accomodations was due to the great rate we recieved, (about 1/2 price from posted rates).. but in any case, the Hotel was nice, clean and staff was great! The Longwharf would be our first choice when we return for a 2nd visit....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robocop646
Reviews.Content: My wife and I from UK in Essex booked in at a Bed and Breakfast in Cambridge during our tour of New England. One of these 'genuine' old worlde places - had intended to stay three night. - it was awful. Booked out the next day and telephoned Marriott for proper accommodation. Went to Marriot Copley which is in heart of Boston, another good hotel but eventually settled on the Marriot on Wharf. Room superb, service as well except doormen who wanted tips everytime they looked at you. We went on all the tourist trips, do not miss USS Constitution. Great restaurants. Thoroughly recommend this chain to anyone EXCEPT the Marriott in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dfranko
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf for a few nights last week, and never had to waste time getting anywhere. The "T" could not be easier to use and there is a T-stop right outside the hotel front door. Easy walk to any downtown or North End spots, we even walked it once all the way to Fenway Park. We also took the T to and from Fenway (Kenmore Square stop) a couple of times and it couldn't have been easier. Also ideally located for quick getaway to Logan Airport by the T or by water taxi, also adjacent to the hotel. The water taxi is $10 per trip; the T is $1.25 per trip. The hotel itself was real nice. They gave us an early check-in and our 5th floor room was standard but very clean and with a tremendous view of the harbor. There is so much to do within walking distance that you don't need to stay in your room much. We ate at the breakafst buffet twice which was excellent. Didn't try the hotel restaurant any other times, there are more restaurants within a short walk than you need. Also experienced excellent concierge service for a few different items, same for the doorman. It may be a bit pricey, but it is more than made up for through convenience, especially if you are only in Boston for a short time and want to get the most out of your time there.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaverickHoney
Reviews.Content: Our family has just returned from Boston and a 4 night stay at the Marriott Long Wharf. We could not have been more pleased. The location is perfect. It is in walking distance to everything plus the added feature of being right on the bay. We had two rooms and both had beautiful views. The service was excellent. Everything in the hotel looked new and fresh. The city of Boston is so rich in history and beauty. We would have loved to have more time there but packed all we could into the 4 days we had. The whale watching tour was spectacular and you purchase tickets and board the boat right outside the Marriott. We saw at least 8 whales and could not believe how close 2 of them were to us. Taking in a Red Sox game is a must and the meal at Beer Works near the stadium was great. We also highly recommend the Union Oyster House for dinner. We rented a car and drove over to Cape Cod for a day trip. We choose the town of Chatham due to recommendations from some of the locals sitting next to us at the ballgame. It was absolutely beautiful or "lovely" as the locals had descriped. We certainly plan to return as soon as we can. You can't go wrong with the Marriott or a trip to Boston!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book me into the Marriott Long Wharf”
Reviews.Author: pentlandpirate
Reviews.Content: Twice someone has booked me into the Marriott Long Wharf. Twice I've been badly stung by the price. This is a perfectly good hotel, good position for downtown, on seafront, but I just loathe their pricing policy which goes up alarmingly whenever there is demand in the city. OK it is just market forces you may say, but the difference between their low season and high season rates is so great you can't help but feel you are being ripped off when you have to pay USD 450.00 + a night for a standard room. Afterall the hotel facilities don't change week to week.....the rooms are the same....the service is the same. I will never stay at the Boston Marriott Long Wharf again on principle. You can get excellent B&B's in the much more charismatic Italian quarter a short distance away for a fraction of the price, and a much more individual and personal experience too. I know I am not alone in my sentiments about the pricing as I have come across other businessmen across the world who make a special case of telling how they were ripped off by Boston hotel pricing at the Marriott Long Wharf. We make a special case now of phoning ahead to say, "Don't book me in at the Boston Marriott Long Wharf!"

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Nanachelle
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a nice 5-day stay at the Marriott, Long Warf in Boston in June of 2006. The location was excellent - "T" (metro) stop on site, walking distance to countless shops, restaurants, entertainment, the Aquarium/IMAX theaters, the Boston Commons, Little Italy, etc. Our hotel room overlooked the aquarium. We saw the sea lions swimming in their tank from our room - which my 7-yr old daughter loved! There is a Starbucks on the lower level of the building which is great for a quick, inexpensive breakfast. Also the Ocean restaurant has a very nice (although a bit expensive) brunch with a great view. The staff - and especially, "Bellman Bob" were very friendly and helpful. Also, the hotel gym was excellent - including an indoor pool with separate rooms for the weight equipment and aerobic machines. My only complaint was that the housecleaning was quite lacking - stains on the carpet; dust everywhere, mildew stains in the bathroom grout, hairs on bathroom floors when we arrived, etc. (I think this must be a management issue with the Marriott, because we had a similar experience in NYC at the Marriott East following our stay at the Boston, Long Warf location.) Perhaps I am too picky - but because the hotel is a reputable chain and the price of hotel was not cheap, I expected more on this level. Overall I would recommend the hotel because of its location, amenities and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillDen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while so that we could be in the middle of everything in Boston. If I went back, I would certainly stay here again. It is close to everything and right on the water. It is close to the Chart House Restaurant and the Aquarium. The lobby was great and everyone was very friendly. The layout of the hotel is definitely different; however, it is very nice. The only downfall is the $40+ per night parking. However, you must consider that you are staying downtown Boston and that's just the price you pay for convenience. The beds were nice; however, they will soon need some upgrading. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location~ Very happy”
Reviews.Author: moglie33
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Boston Marriott Long Wharf in late May. I found the staff very helpful, from the front desk to housekeeping. The rooms were not huge, but not small either. We had 2 adults and 3 children. And we were comfortable enough. (we obviously had to get a cot) but my fourteen year old said it was very comfortable. We were there with friends and they were able to accomodate us and give us connecting rooms. The rooms were very clean, and the beds very comfortable. They had an Indoor pool, which is always a plus when traveling with kids. The view from our room was of the harbor....but what was priceless, was when you exited out the back door of the hotel, you were literally a 1 minute walk to a playground on the waterfront, a 2 minute walk to the quincy market/ fanuail hall area, and a 5 minute walk to the north end (italian section with a ton of italian bakeries and restaurants, very quaint), and a 2 minute walk to access the freedom trail. We were walking back from the north end around 11 pm, and felt safe the entire time. There were a ton of restaurants within a couple minute walk of any direction. The aquarium was across the street. Parking was a little on the steep side, but competitive with city parking (I think it was $35 a night) While the rooms weren't cheap, they were very reasonable for Boston, and you could not ask for a better location. This is definately where we would stay when returning to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jtona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights 1st weekend in March. First time at this location and I must say WOW. it is close to Faneuil Hall,Quincy Market, Legals Seafood. They offer Valet parking @ $40 day with in/out service. That is on top of the room charge. Check in was fast and eficient . we had room facing Faneuil hall area but view of city was great. Room was clean and Bed was VERY comfortable. BR doors were weird they had dual doors ,but you could see thru small slit in middle,also very small. But overall room was nice. Room service arrived promptly at time I had circled on door tag i had put out previous night. Food was warm,coffee hot. Ate at small restauraunt beside hotel called the Chart House and it was superb. Next day ate at Legal seafoods Excellent also. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Nixsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and found the hotel excellent. Typical US hotel I guess but rooms were large and well appointed, very clean and bathroom superb. We had requested a smoking room but none were available when we arrived - never mind - the view more than made up for it. Convenient location and close to subway. Staff extremely helpful. Starbucks in the lobby!!! Great stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Loved My Stay”
Reviews.Author: GordonPrincess
Reviews.Content: The room is clean and a nice size- I was able to get a king, non-smoking at the end of a hall to avoid a lot of noise. My boyfriend and I were up late, but around 1ish we heard drunk people yelling and because of the way the hotel is designed, all the rooms and floors are in a square and each floor is left open so that whatever floor you are on you can go out into the hallway and look down to see the elevators and entrance way. Also, we put our little tag out to order b-fast in the morning to have ready and when it never came I called room service and they said they never received it and "the kids" must have taken it off. Room service is pricey and the French toast cold and the fruit not so fresh, so eat out when possible. Sounds negative, but the check-in people were great, great view of the harbor and walk to North End (try E-UNO!) and to Fanueil Hall without cab ride. If you are coming in through North Station with bags take a cab as its about $5. Only feet from the aquarium as well. You can walk anywhere from here and there is a Starbucks in the lobby- cheaper and better coffee than the hotels (they donâ€™t take Starbucks gc). Also, we spent hours in the hotel bar relaxing with live jazz music, multiple tv's, and great bartenders and drinks. I would stay again. Booked through AAA for $218 plus taxes. See my photos...

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on using the wifi”
Reviews.Author: slfisher
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice -- nice beds, lots of pillows of various kinds, down comforters, nice sheets, clean, nice shampoos and things. The tub is small; I'm 5'3" and I just fit. Plenty of hot water, and there's this neat system where the towel rack is *inside* the shower, and the towels don't get wet and they get nice and warm. The buffet meals were very good. My complaint is about the Internet connectivity; first, they don't even tell you there's wifi, just give you two one-foot cables that can only be used from the desk. I did a search for wifi and did find it, which cost $10 a day. I was surprised, though, when I went to the conference facility, and couldn't get wifi. Oh, I was told, the wifi is only for the rooms! In fact, if I wanted to use the wifi in the lobby, that was run by Starbucks and I'd have to pay an *additional* $10 a day. If I wanted to use the Internet in the conference facility, I'd have to pay $300 for the first connection and $100 after that! They said this was due to performance, and I can believe it; even in the room, the wifi kept dropping. So, don't come here expecting to be able to work during a conference...

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Marriott Long Wharf and we were very pleasantly surprised. The location, of course, is wonderful (adjacent to the aquarium and within walking distance to many shops, restaurants, and Faneuil Hall). What we were not expecting is that the rooms would be as nice as they were. The views of the harbor are terrific, and the rooms are quite plush - wonderful beds with fluffy duvets and down pillows, nicely appointed bathrooms (a bit small) with granite countertops, and very attentive service from the staff. Any request was dealt with immediately, and the staff was very warm and friendly while still being professional. The restaurant, Oceana, was terrific - we ate in the bar area for lighter fare but their dining room is lovely with windows overlooking the harbor. Room service arrived perfectly on time, and they weren't looking for an extra tip above the service charge (many hotels leave you wondering if you've done enough). A small complaint is that because the interior of the hotel is an atrium, noise can carry and sometimes young children playing in the lobby in the morning can disturb you. If you leave the heat/ac fan on in the room that tends to muffle any noise. One more great feature of the hotel is that there is a pay-per-movie system on the television that features first run movies that are yet to be released on DVD - I've never seen that before in any hotel. We really loved the hotel - it was a wonderful, comfy and cozy way to spend a weekend in New England!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance to great restaurants, (Legal's, Sel de la Terre) Fanueil Hall, Aquarium, and all the best Boston has to offer. Great views of waterfront from rooms and restaurant. Found rooms clean, bright, attractive and comfortable. Front desk, housekeeping and valet all were very accommodating and friendly. Great fitness center. Small indoor pool but with great view of Boston Harbor. Lobby is a bit dated and not very welcoming. Nice Starbucks cafe on 1st level. Lounge is spacious and very busy. Only major downfall is Oceania Restaurant which had very bad service and food. We were also the only ones in the huge dining room for dinner which made it a bit depressing and slow service not understandable. Too bad as it's a beautiful room with great view of Boston Harbor. Breakfast was more crowded with better food and service. Have stayed here a few times and always seems full with families and tourists which may not appeal to some business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Too little for too much”
Reviews.Author: PageturnerInk
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our two night stay at the Marriott Long Wharf. Besides the fact that the room was small (certainly for two adults and one child), both nights we had to call the front desk because of the noise in adjoining rooms which made it impossible to go to sleep. Both nights the front desk sent up security. The experience of being this aggravated on our vacation made the view from the window and the convenience of the location pale in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our one night stay at the Long Wharf Marriott. After spending much time searching for the right hotel the Long Wharf was a good choice. The hotel was very nice and the location couldn't have been better. The only thing that was negative was that months in advance I had requested a high floor and got a first floor room, but other than that the hotel was great.

HotelInfo.Name: Boston Marriott Long Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 296 State Street, Boston, MA 02109
